trait.name: Peaceful Aura, Fearsome Presence
entries: Beipiaosaurus is a docile creature, calmly feeding on vegetation in the chilly mountains of Yixian. However, if attacked, Beipiaosaurus will erupt into a frenzy of slashing claws. The first time Beipiaosaurus is attacked, the attacking creature must succeed a {@dc 12} Charisma saving throw or be {@condition frightened} of Beipiaosaurus until the end of their next turn.

trait.name: Slow Metabolism
entries: Beipiaosaurus has advantage on saving throws to prevent the {@condition poisoned} condition. However, if it does become {@condition poisoned}, the duration of that condition is doubled.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: If Beipiaosaurus chooses the attack action, it may make two Sabre-Clawed Slash attacks.

action.name: Sabre-Clawed Slash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) damage.
A creature hit by this attack must succeed a {@dc 10} Constitution saving throw or take {@dice 1d6} additional slashing damage.

trait.name: Altruistic Behaviour
entries: When attacked, a herd of Bolong will tend to flee. However, one will always stay behind to buy time for the others to escape. That Bolong will attack and fight to the death. The other individuals will only fight if they are cornered or cannot escape.

trait.name: Thundering Charge
entries: If Bolong moves at least 20 ft. in a straight line before using its Crushing Bulk attack, that attack deals an additional {@damage 2d6} bludgeoning damage this turn, but also deals {@damage 1d6} bludgeoning damage to Bolong on a successful hit.

trait.name: Defensive Gouge
entries: If Bolong is hit by a melee attack, it may use its reaction to make a single Thumb Gouge attack at the creature that hit it.
Hadrosauroids are frequently portrayed as relatively
harmless animals that could only flee from danger.
However, any modern large herbivore can be extremely
dangerous, either because it is naturally aggressive or
because it will use its bulk to defend itself. Hadrosauroids
had thick, powerful tails which could strike attackers and
Bolong possessed a thumb spike which could be used to
fight predators (or other Bolong). Most hadrosauroids are
also thought to have been communal animals, who were
likely involved and protective parents, similar to
modern cows.
We suggest Bolong be played as an apparently peaceful
grazing animal, but with both the capacity for extreme
aggression (especially if protecting young) and sudden
panic, fleeing en-mass

action.name: Crushing Bulk
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Thumb Gouge
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Scratch
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}2({@damage 1d2 +1 }) slashing damage.

trait.name: Arboreal
entries: If Microraptor uses the Dash action, do not increase its flight speed, but instead triple its climb speed. Microraptor also has advantage on Stealth checks while in a wooded or forested environment.

trait.name: Feathered and Evasive.
entries: When making a Dexterity saving throw to take half damage from an attack, spell, or effect, Microraptor instead takes no damage if the saving throw is succeeded.

trait.name: Predatory Ancestors
entries: Beipiaosaurus retains the nocturnal hunter-killer instincts of its predatory theropod ancestors. At night, Beipiaosaurus gains the following temporary changes:

items: It has darkvision 60 ft.
Its movement speed is 35 ft. and its climb speed is 20 ft.
It has advantage on Perception checks.
It has resistance to non-magical bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.
It has vulnerability to radiant damage.
It has an aversion to bright light.
It loses its "Peaceful Aura, Fearsome Presence" ability.

action.name: Bo's Dragon {@recharge 4}
entries: As an action, Bolong may spit a ball of burning ash at a point within 20 ft. of it. The ground within a 10 ft. radius from that point is engulfed in burning embers and flame.

For the next minute, any creature that starts its turn within or moves into this area must succeed a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 3d6 + 3} fire damage. On a success they take half as much damage.

trait.name: Familiar
entries: Microraptor may be used as a familiar via the {@spell Find Familiar} spell or any similar effect.

trait.name: Shimmering Feathers (2/day)
entries: Microraptor is protected by a layer of iridescent feathers that can be used to misdirect and confuse attackers. When hit by an attack, Microraptor can use its reaction to increase its AC by 2 until the end of the turn.

trait.name: Quilled Back
entries: The quills on Psittacosaurus' back make it dangerous to hit. If Psittacosaurus is hit by a melee attack, it may use its reaction to make a Quill Stab attack at the attacking creature.

trait.name: Vast Herd
entries: Psittacosaurus swarm in vast herds of dozens to hundreds of individuals, roaming the mountainsides, rivers, and hills. When fleeing from a threat, it is difficult to make out individual Psittacosaurus among the crowd. So long as there are three or more Psittacosaurus fleeing within 20 ft. of each other, ranged attacks against them are at disadvantage.

trait.name: Group Sentinel
entries: If three or more Psittacosaurus are together, select one of them to be the Group Sentinel. That Psittacosaurus has advantage on Perception checks.

action.name: Beak Snap
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Quill Stab
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) piercing damage.

action.name: Quill Spray
entries: As an action, Psittacosaurus can fire a spray of quills. Each creature in a 10 ft. cone in front of Psittacosaurus must succeed a {@dc 11} Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 1d4 + 1} piercing damage.

trait.name: Thick Feathered Coat
entries: Yutyrannus has immunity to cold damage and resistance to non-magical bludgeoning and piercing damage.
If Yutyrannus falls below half health, it loses its resistance to piercing and bludgeoning damage and replaces its immunity to cold damage with resistance to cold damage.

trait.name: Arch-Predator
entries: Yutyrannus cannot be easily swayed from the hunt. It has advantage on Charisma and Wisdom saving throws.

trait.name: Call the Pack (1/day)
entries: As a bonus action, Yutyrannus can let out a gut-wrenching bellow alerting other members of its pack to the conflict.
At the start of the next round, up to two additional Yutyrannus join the combat as allies to this Yutyrannus. They approach from nearby cover and do not have the Call the Pack ability.

If this ability is used by a polymorphed or otherwise shapeshifted humanoid, their friends, family, or party members are considered to be their 'pack' instead, and are made aware of the conflict, regardless of where they are.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: If Yutyrannus chooses the attack action, it may make one Feathermaw Bite attack and two Feathered Claw attacks.

action.name: Feathermaw Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 4d6 + 5}) piercing damage.

If a creature hit by this attack is Medium or smaller, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 16}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the Yutyrannus cannot Feathermaw Bite another target.

action.name: Feathered Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d12 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Downy Shoulder Bash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}23 ({@damage 4d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

If Yutyrannus moved at least 30 ft. before using this attack, a creature hit by this attack must succeed a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If Yutyrannus knocks a creature {@condition prone} with this attack, it may then make a single Feathered Claw attack against that creature.

legendary.name: Coordinate
entries: Yutyrannus signals its pack with grumbles and tail flicks. On its next turn, Yutyrannus has advantage on attack rolls against any creature that has at least one other Yutyrannus within 10 ft. of it that isn't incapacitated.

legendary.name: Hunt
entries: Yutyrannus searches for its prey. It may make a Perception check. If a hidden creature within 60 ft. has taken damage, Yutyrannus has advantage on this check, specifically for detecting that creature (disregard the additional d20 for all uninjured creatures).

(to a minimum of 5 ft.). On a successful save they take half as much damage and are otherwise unaffected.

legendary.name: Frenzy
entries: Yutyrannus may move up to 5 ft. and make a Feathered Claw attack.

trait.name: Dexterous Aquatic Predator
entries: While submerged in water, the Bahariyan Polycotylid has advantage on Dexterity checks, advantage on Dexterity saving throws, advantage on saving throws to prevent it from being {@condition restrained}, and cannot be knocked {@condition prone}. The Bahariyan Polycotylid can also hold its breath for up to 10 minutes.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: If the Bahariyan Polycotylid chooses the attack action, it may make one Swim-by Bite attack and one Paddle Slap attack.

action.name: Swim-by Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Paddle Slap
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d4 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Stir Mud
entries: If submerged in water, as an action, the Bahariyan Polycotylid can use its paddles to stir up sediment from the riverbed/seabed. For 30 seconds all connected water within 30 ft. becomes clouded with mud, rendering it opaque. A creature submerged in this water is considered {@condition blinded} and heavily obscured.

trait.name: Titanic Fighter
entries: Carcharodontosaurus has advantage on attacks against creatures with a size category of Large, Huge, or Gargantuan. Carcharodontosaurus also has resistance to slashing damage.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (1/day)
entries: If Carcharodontosaurus fails a saving throw, it may choose to succeed it instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: If Carcharodontosaurus chooses the attack action, it may make three Ripping Bite attacks.

action.name: Ripping Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}24 ({@damage 4d8 + 6}) piercing damage.
When a creature is hit by this attack, if it is not already affected by the 'Torn' condition, it gains the 'Torn' condition (see below).

action.name: Condition: Torn
entries: A torn creature has had a large piece of flesh ripped away from its body and is bleeding heavily.

At the start of its turn in combat or every minute outside of combat, the creature must succeed a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 3d6} slashing damage. On a successful save they take half as much damage.
This effect persists until one of the following occurs:

items: The creature is healed by at least 25 hit points.
The creature finishes a long rest (do not make saves while resting but begin again if the rest is interrupted).
A {@dc 18} Medicine check is passed on the creature.
A {@spell lesser restoration} spell is cast on the creature.
It dies.

legendary.name: Adapt
entries: Roll a {@dice d20}, on a 10 to 20, you may replace one of Carcharodontosaurus' mutations with another of your choice from the same table. On the roll of a 1 to 9 you must replace one of Carcharodontosaurus' mutations with another randomly determined mutation from the same table.

immune.note: from nonmagical attacks from non-Huge/Gargantuan/Colossal sources

trait.name: Immutable Stature
entries: Paralititan is immune to being {@condition frightened} or knocked {@condition prone}. It has advantage on Strength saving throws, and any saving throw to resist being {@condition paralyzed} or {@condition poisoned}. However, it automatically fails any Dexterity saving throw.
Non-magical bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing attacks have no effect on it as its hide is far too thick. Attacks from Huge, Gargantuan, and Colossal creatures bypass this immunity.

trait.name: Bellowing Call
entries: As a bonus action, Paralititan may let out a bellowing call. This is a deep guttural rumble that shakes the very core of other creatures. Each other non-Paralititan creature within 60 ft. must succeed a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} of Paralititan for 1 minute. They may repeat this save at the end of their turn and on a successful save are immune to the effect for 24 hours.

action.name: Rear Up
entries: As an action, Paralititan can rear up onto its hind limbs. If it does, its speed is reduced to 0 ft. and it is able to use its Almighty Stomp attack until it is no longer rearing up.
If Paralititan takes the attack action, or makes an attack of opportunity as a reaction, it lands on all fours and it ceases rearing up.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: If Paralititan chooses the attack action, it may make two Huge Stomp attacks. Alternatively, it may make a single Almighty Stomp attack if it is rearing up.

action.name: Huge Stomp
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}28 ({@damage 4d8 + 10}) bludgeoning damage.
A creature hit by this attack must succeed a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Almighty Stomp
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 10 ft., up to two targets. {@h}75 ({@damage 10d10 + 20}) bludgeoning damage. Paralititan must be rearing up to use this attack.

Any creature hit by this attack is knocked {@condition prone}. All other non-sauropod creatures within 30 ft. of Paralititan must succeed a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or also be knocked {@condition prone}. Any non-magical metal, stone, or wooden object not being carried or worn hit by this attack is shattered and destroyed.

immune.note: from nonmagical attacks from non-Huge/Gargantuan/Colossal sources

trait.name: Lightning Rod
entries: The first time Paralititan uses its Bellowing Call ability each day, the sky darkens and storm clouds form directly above it. For the next hour, each time Paralititan uses its Bellowing Call, any creature within 20 ft. of it (including itself) must succeed a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 3d10} lightning damage. They take half as much damage on a successful save.
After an hour passes, the storm clears.

action.name: Almighty Stomp
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 10 ft., up to two targets. {@h}75 ({@damage 10d10 + 20}) bludgeoning damage. Paralititan must be rearing up to use this attack.

trait.name: Reactionary Thermoregulation
entries: When hit by an attack or when making a saving throw, Spinosaurus may use its reaction to gain immunity to fire or cold damage until the end of the turn.

trait.name: Crocodile Mimic
entries: Spinosaurus can hold its breath for up to 30 minutes.

trait.name: Rostral Dermal Pressure Sensors
entries: While submerged in water, Spinosaurus has a blindsight of 10 ft.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: If Spinosaurus chooses the attack action, it may make one Snapping Jaw attack and one Hooked Claw attack.

action.name: Snapping Jaw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}27 ({@damage 5d6 + 10}) piercing damage.

A creature hit by this attack is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 16}) and pulled 5 ft. closer to Spinosaurus. While a creature is grappled by this attack, Spinosaurus cannot attack another target with its Snapping Jaw.

action.name: Hooked Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 3d8 + 8}) slashing damage.
A creature hit by this attack can be moved up to 5 ft. in any direction by Spinosaurus (no save allowed).

trait.name: Dramatic Reinterpretation
entries: Select one option listed below and apply it to Spinosaurus. The next time the party encounter a Spinosaurus, select a different option, which overrides the previously selected option.

items: Increase Spinosaurus' strength to 28, but decrease its dexterity to 10. Its attacks deal {@damage 1d8} additional damage (of the same damage type), but subtract 2 from any rolls to hit.
Change Spinosaurus' speed to 60 ft., but it may no longer swim.
Increase Spinosaurus' AC to 20.
Spinosaurus gains a fly speed of 40 ft. (This may not be selected the first time a party encounter Spinosaurus).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: If Spinosaurus chooses the attack action, it may make one Snapping Jaw attack and one Hooked Claw attack.

action.name: Snapping Jaw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}27 ({@damage 5d6 + 10}) piercing damage.

A creature hit by this attack is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 16}) and pulled 5 ft. closer to Spinosaurus. While a creature is grappled by this attack, Spinosaurus cannot attack another target with its Snapping Jaw.

action.name: Hooked Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 3d8 + 8}) slashing damage.
A creature hit by this attack can be moved up to 5 ft. in any direction by Spinosaurus (no save allowed).

trait.name: Aquatic
entries: Stomatosuchus has advantage on Stealth checks while submerged in water. It can hold its breath for up to 30 minutes.

trait.name: Size Matters
entries: Stomatosuchus will not attack a creature of Medium size or larger, unless to defend itself or its feeding grounds.

trait.name: Throat Pouch
entries: A creature within Stomatosuchus' throat pouch is {@condition restrained} and takes {@damage 2d4} bludgeoning damage at the start of each of their turns. At the end of its turn, the restrained creature may attempt to escape by succeeding on a {@dc 14} Strength check.
If Stomatosuchus falls below half hit points, it will regurgitate any creature in its throat pouch. If a creature dies while in the throat pouch, Stomatosuchus swallows it.

trait.name: Crocodilian Immune System
entries: Stomatosuchus is resistant to poison damage and immune to the {@condition poisoned} condition.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: If Stomatosuchus chooses the attack action, it may make one Needle Maw attack and one Tail Swipe attack.

action.name: Needle Maw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

If Stomatosuchus' throat pouch is empty, it may attempt to swallow a Small or Tiny creature hit by this attack. The target must succeed a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or be swallowed into Stomatosuchus' throat pouch.

action.name: Tail Swipe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Crocodilian Immune System
entries: Stomatosuchus is resistant to poison damage and immune to the {@condition poisoned} condition.

trait.name: Careless Swallow
entries: Stomatosuchus gulps huge volumes of water daily as it filters out tiny fish to devour. In doing so, it occasionally swallows small gemstones or trinkets that wash into the water. Roll a {@dice d6} and consult the list below, Stomatosuchus gains the corresponding effect.

items: 1 - Gemstone. Select a damage type from lightning, cold, fire, or poison. Stomatosuchus' Needle Maw attack deals an additional {@damage 1d4} damage of that type and also change the damage of its Throat Pouch to that type.
2 - Ring of Protection. Increase Stomatosuchus' AC by 1.
3 - Holy Symbol. Stomatosuchus gains immunity to radiant damage.
4 - Gold Coins. Stomatosuchus' throat pouch deals an additional {@damage 1d6} bludgeoning damage and it regurgitates 100 gp when slain.

5 - Wand Shard. Stomatosuchus knows the {@spell Firebolt}, {@spell Ray of Frost}, or {@spell Thunderclap} cantrip. It can cast them as though it were level 5, its spell attack modifier is +4 and any saving throw from its cantrips has a DC of 14.
6 - Ticking Clock. Stomatosuchus loses its Size Matters ability and becomes exceptionally aggressive. It also constantly makes a faint ticking sound.

trait.name: Treasure Trove
entries: When Stomatosuchus is slain, its throat pouch contains {@dice 1d4} trinkets, small items, or gemstones (DM's choice, typically including whatever is described above).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: If Stomatosuchus chooses the attack action, it may make one Needle Maw attack and one Tail Swipe attack.

action.name: Needle Maw

If Stomatosuchus' throat pouch is empty, it may attempt to swallow a Small or Tiny creature hit by this attack. The target must succeed a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or be swallowed into Stomatosuchus' throat pouch.

action.name: Tail Swipe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Flutter-Leap
entries: Balaur can jump up to 30 ft. and is immune to falling damage.

action.name: Pair Bonding
entries: As an action, Balaur may give another allied Balaur within 60 ft. advantage on that Balaur's attacks and saving throws until the start of this Balaur's next turn.

action.name: Twin Claw Grapple
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d4 + 2}) piercing damage.
A creature hit by this attack must succeed a {@dc 10} Strength saving throw or be {@condition grappled} by Balaur.

trait.name: Twin Spirited
entries: The first time Balaur is reduced to 0 hit points, so long as it used Pair Bonding at least once, or was the target of another Balaur's Pair Bonding, it is revived with full hit points although it has an ethereal ghost-like appearance. Its Twin Claw Grapple attack now deals necrotic damage instead of piercing.

action.name: Pair Bonding

trait.name: Crop
entries: Hatzegopteryx has a large throat pouch called a crop that is able to hold a Medium or smaller sized creature. Creatures inside this crop are {@condition restrained} and suffer {@damage 4d4} bludgeoning damage at the start of their turn. There is only enough air within the crop to breathe for 1 minute.
While a creature is inside its crop, Hatzegopteryx's fly speed is reduced by half, it cannot dash, and it will generally attempt to flee a fight to keep its meal.
A swallowed creature may attempt to escape by making a {@dc 17} Strength check. On a success, they are regurgitated. Alternatively, if Hatzegopteryx falls below 100 hit points, they are regurgitated.

trait.name: Evasive Flying
entries: If Hatzegopteryx makes a Dexterity saving throw while flying to take only half damage from an attack, spell, or effect, it instead takes no damage if the saving throw is succeeded.
Hatzegopteryx cannot make Dexterity saving throws against attacks, spells, or effects that originated from within its crop.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (1/day)
entries: If Hatzegopteryx fails a saving throw, it may instead choose to succeed.

trait.name: Swallow
entries: So long as Hatzegopteryx has at least 100 hit points, as a bonus action it may attempt to swallow a creature that is lying {@condition prone}. The creature must succeed a {@dc 16} Strength or Dexterity saving throw (their choice) or be swallowed into Hatzegopteryx's crop.

trait.name: Heavy Flier
entries: Hatzegopteryx can only begin flying by using its Quad Launch Legendary Action, or if it is falling. Hatzegopteryx is also immune to thunder damage.

action.name: Grounded Multiattack
entries: If Hatzegopteryx chooses the attack action while standing on the ground, it may make one Beak Spear attack and two Beak Flurry attacks.

action.name: Beak Spear
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}30 ({@damage 5d8 + 8}) piercing damage.
A creature hit by this attack must succeed a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone} and {@condition stunned} until the end of their next turn.

action.name: Beak Flurry
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) piercing damage.
A target hit by this attack must succeed a {@dc 12} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

legendary.name: Quad Launch
entries: Hatzegopteryx launches itself into the air. Every other creature within 10 ft. of Hatzegopteryx must succeed a {@dc 18} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. Hatzegopteryx then begins to fly and must fly 20 ft. in a straight line (either horizontally, or vertically up).
Hatzegopteryx cannot use this Legendary Action next battle round.

trait.name: Crop

Creatures inside this crop are {@condition restrained} and suffer {@damage 4d4} bludgeoning damage at the start of their turn. There is only enough air within the crop to breathe for 1 minute.
While a creature is inside its crop, Hatzegopteryx's fly speed is reduced by half, it cannot dash, and it will generally attempt to flee a fight to keep its meal.
A swallowed creature may attempt to escape by making a {@dc 17} Strength check. On a success, they are regurgitated. Alternatively, if Hatzegopteryx falls below 100 hit points, they are regurgitated.

trait.name: Heavy Flier
entries: Hatzegopteryx can only begin flying by using its Quad Launch Legendary Action, or if it is falling. Hatzegopteryx is also immune to thunder damage.

trait.name: Unnatural Resistance
entries: Hatzegopteryx is resistant to both magical and non-magical bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage as well as cold, fire, and lightning damage.

trait.name: Sonic Shockwave (1/day)
entries: Hatzegopteryx may choose to forgo its action and bonus action this round. If it does so, its fly speed is increased to 600 ft. and, if it moves its maximum fly distance in a straight line, it may emit a Sonic Shockwave at any point along that route.
When it does, each other creature within 120 ft. of Hatzegopteryx must succeed a {@dc 19} Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 12d8} thunder damage. On a success they take half as much damage.
Hatzegopteryx may only perform a Sonic Shockwave if there are no creatures in its crop.

Hatzegopteryx cannot use this Legendary Action next battle round.

legendary.name: Screech
entries: Hatzegopteryx lets out a harrowing screech. Each other creature within 60 ft. must succeed a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 2d6} thunder damage and be {@condition frightened} of Hatzegopteryx for 1 minute. A creature can make a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw at the end of each of its turns, and on a success they are no longer {@condition frightened} of Hatzegopteryx and cannot be frightened of it again for the next 24 hours.

trait.name: Sweeping Defence
entries: When hit by a melee attack, Magyarosaurus may use its reaction to make a Neck Bludgeon attack against the creature that attacked it.

action.name: Rear Up

If Magyarosaurus takes the attack action, or makes an attack of opportunity as a reaction, it lands on all fours and it ceases rearing up.

A creature hit by this attack must succeed a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}2 ({@damage 1d4}) slashing damage plus 2 ({@damage 1d4}) bludgeoning damage.

While it has that resistance, its Bladed Osteoderms deal an additional {@damage 1d2} damage of that damage type. This resistance is lost if it attacks.

trait.name: Curse: Reverberation of Cowardice
entries: A creature cursed by Reverberation of Cowardice must succeed a {@dc 10} Wisdom saving throw each time it enters combat or be {@condition frightened} of all enemies for 1 minute. The creature can repeat this saving throw at the end of each of its turns to end the {@condition frightened} condition (until it re-enters combat).
This curse can be removed by a {@spell Lesser Restoration} spell or similar effect, or ends after 24 hours.

trait.name: Perfect Preservation

Ludodactylus then begins to fly and must fly 15 ft. in a straight line (either horizontally, or vertically up).
Ludodactylus can only begin flying by using this ability, or if it is falling.

The target creature must succeed a {@dc 11} Strength saving throw or Ludodactylus plucks the item from them and holds it in its beak.

entries: Tupandactylus is immune to thunder damage and its Beak-Slash attack deals an additional {@damage 1d6} thunder damage.

trait.name: Focused on Flirting
entries: If Tupandactylus performed a Dazzling Display or Thundering Display, it has disadvantage on Perception checks for the next 1 minute.

trait.name: Quad Launch (Tupandactylus)
entries: If not already flying, as a bonus action, Tupandactylus can launch itself into the air. Every other creature within 5 ft. of it must succeed a {@dc 12} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. Tupandactylus then begins to fly and must fly 20 ft. in a straight line (either horizontally, or vertically up).
Tupandactylus can only begin flying by using this ability, or if it is falling.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: If Tupandactylus chooses the attack action, it may make two attacks with its Beak-Slash attack.

action.name: Beak-Slash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) slashing damage plus {@damage 1d6} thunder damage.

action.name: Dazzling Display
entries: As an action, Tupandactylus can perform a Dazzling Display. Performing the display gives Tupandactylus advantage on all Charisma saving throws and checks for the next 1 minute.

Additionally, any creature within 20 ft. and line of sight of Tupandactylus must try and avert their gaze. They must succeed a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw or have disadvantage on all Charisma saving throws and checks for the next 1 minute.

action.name: Thundering Display {@recharge 3}
entries: As an action, Tupandactylus can channel the power of thunder, generating a shockwave by suddenly vibrating its wings.

All other creatures within 15 ft. must succeed a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 3d6} thunder damage and attack with disadvantage until the end of their next turn. On a successful save they take half as much damage and are otherwise unaffected.

trait.name: Filamentous Integument Mane
entries: Ubirajara has advantage on Stealth checks while in foliage and, when hit by an attack, can use its reaction to reduce any bludgeoning or piercing damage it would take from that attack by half. Ubirajara also gains a +5 bonus to Intimidation checks.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: If Ubirajara chooses the attack action, it may make three Gnashing Nip attacks.

action.name: Gnashing Nip
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Filamentous Integument Mane
entries: Ubirajara has advantage on Stealth checks while in foliage and, when hit by an attack, can use its reaction to reduce any bludgeoning or piercing damage it would take from that attack by half. Ubirajara also gains a +5 bonus to Intimidation checks.

trait.name: Return Home (1/day)
entries: As an action, Ubirajara can attempt to return back to its home. It opens an interplanar portal 10 ft. in front of itself. The portal leads to a destination that it considers to be home anywhere in the multiverse and remains open for 1 minute or until Ubirajara falls unconscious. The portal is big enough to allow creatures up to a size of Large through it.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: If Ubirajara chooses the attack action, it may make three Gnashing Nip attacks. Alternatively, it may make a single Filamentous Spear attack.

action.name: Gnashing Nip
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) piercing damage.

action.name: Filamentous Spear
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 30 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) piercing damage.

resist.note: during the day (see Sail Reliant Reptilian Metabolism)
during the night (see Sail Reliant Reptilian Metabolism)

trait.name: Dorsal Sail
entries: As a bonus action, Arizonasaurus can flush its sail with blood, giving it advantage on Intimidation checks for 1 minute.

trait.name: Sail Reliant Reptilian Metabolism
entries: During the day, Arizonasaurus is resistant to cold damage. During the night, Arizonasaurus is resistant to fire damage.

action.name: Bite and Shake
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage. A creature hit by this attack must succeed a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or take an additional {@damage 1d6} slashing damage and, if they are Medium or smaller, are {@condition grappled} until the start of Arizonasaurus's next turn.

Occasionally, the doldrum of the scrub'n'dry rock was broken by large, fanned sails dottin' the horizon. We learnt pretty quickly to give these a wide berth, as the beasties that they was attached to were vicious predators. Although sluggish at first, these thin's could dash right up and deliver some really nasty bites. If you gotta pass em, do it in the early mornin' when they're baskin' to warm 'emselves.

resist.note: during the day (see Sail Reliant Reptilian Metabolism)
during the night (see Sail Reliant Reptilian Metabolism)

trait.name: Dorsal Sail
entries: As a bonus action, Arizonasaurus can flush its sail with blood, giving it advantage on Intimidation checks for 1 minute.

trait.name: Sail Reliant Reptilian Metabolism
entries: During the day, Arizonasaurus is resistant to cold damage. During the night, Arizonasaurus is resistant to fire damage.

trait.name: Arizona Heat
entries: Arizonasaurus radiates incredible heat. Any creature that starts its turn within or comes within 20 ft. of Arizonasaurus immediately suffers {@damage 1d6} fire damage. This is increased to {@damage 2d6} if they are within 5 ft. of Arizonasaurus. Additionally, Arizonasaurus is immune to fire damage.
If there are multiple Arizonasaurus persisting in a region with this ability, that region will experience a prolonged drought.

action.name: Bite and Shake
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage. A creature hit by this attack must succeed a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or take an additional {@damage 1d6} slashing damage and, if they are Medium or smaller, are {@condition grappled} until the start of Arizonasaurus's next turn.

Although sluggish at first, these thin's could dash right up and deliver some really nasty bites. If you gotta pass em, do it in the early mornin' when they're baskin' to warm 'emselves.

trait.name: Frill Shield
entries: If Centrosaurus is facing the direction that an attack originated from, increase Centrosaurus' AC by 2 against that attack.

trait.name: Dazzling Display
entries: As a bonus action, Centrosaurus may flood its frill with blood, creating a bright colourful display. All enemy creatures within 30 ft. of Centrosaurus that can see it must succeed a {@dc 10} Charisma saving throw or have disadvantage on saving throws for the next 1 minute.

trait.name: Tenacious Herbivore
entries: Centrosaurus has advantage on Wisdom saving throws.

action.name: Horn Swipe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., up to two targets. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Horn Charge
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 3d6 + 8}) piercing damage. Centrosaurus may only use this attack if it moved at least 20 ft. in a straight line before reaching the target on this turn.

Some herbivores are much more aggressive than others. We had setup a small, fixed camp on the edges of a large forest, hoping to eventually establish a permanent settlement later. The area was perfect  clear flat shrubland with a small stream for fresh water. After a week of work, one afternoon we were alerted to an approachin' herd of ceratops. They were bearin' down on us at speed, hootin' and honkin'. Within moments, a bull had charged through our camp, trampling four tents and injurin' two labourers. Evidently, this was their clearin' and they weren't happy to share.

entries: As a bonus action, Centrosaurus may flood its frill with blood, creating a bright colourful display. All enemy creatures within 30 ft. of Centrosaurus that can see it must succeed a {@dc 10} Charisma saving throw or have disadvantage on saving throws for the next 1 minute.

trait.name: Mirror Image: Monoclonius (1/day)
entries: As a bonus action, Centrosaurus can cast {@spell Mirror Image} at 2nd level without requiring components or a spell slot. Each of the illusions is of an extremely similar, perhaps identical, dinosaur called Monoclonius and persist for 24 hours (rather than 1 minute).
When approaching a herd of Centrosaurus, at least one will already have this spell active.

trait.name: Mysterious Hump: Micro-thermoregulation
entries: When hit by an attack or when failing a saving throw, Concavenator can use its reaction to gain resistance to fire or cold damage until the end of the turn.

trait.name: Mysterious Hump: Display
entries: Concavenator has advantage on Charisma checks.

trait.name: Mysterious Hump: Fatty Storage
entries: Concavenator only needs to drink once per month.

trait.name: Muscular Forearms
entries: Concavenator has advantage on any Strength checks to avoid being grappled.

action.name: Combined Claw and Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) slashing damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

It took us forty minutes to realise that we were bein' hunted. By that point, an encounter was inevitable. We setup a defensive position to stand our ground and braced ourselves for battle. Before long, we were bein' circled by three meat-eatin' dinosaurs. Although your typical theropods with wicked claws and sharp teeth, these ones also had a strange lil' hump over their hips. Didn't have the time to ponder what those might be for though, as moments after I spotted 'em, they charged to attack all at once.

trait.name: Mysterious Hump: Micro-thermoregulation
entries: When hit by an attack or when failing a saving throw, Concavenator can use its reaction to gain resistance to fire or cold damage until the end of the turn.

trait.name: Mysterious Hump: Display

trait.name: Mysterious Hump: Fatty Storage
entries: Concavenator only needs to drink once per month.

trait.name: Muscular Forearms
entries: Concavenator has advantage on any Strength checks to avoid being grappled.

trait.name: Landshark
entries: Concavenator gains a tremorsense of 30 ft. and a burrowing speed of 30 ft., but cannot burrow through solid stone. While burrowing, it gains resistance to non-magical bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage, and is heavily obscured (although its general location is revealed by its protruding hump, which glides along the ground).

action.name: Combined Claw and Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) slashing damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Burrowing Dive
entries: As an action, Concavenator may burrow downwards to go deeper underground, preparing to strike its next target. While burrowing deeper underground, it is entirely obscured and cannot attack or be attacked, except when attacking/attacked by another burrowing creature.

On its next turn, Concavenator can burst upwards, unearthing itself and ending its burrowing. If it does so, it has advantage on attack rolls until the end of its turn, but cannot use the Burrowing Dive ability again until the start of its next turn.

It took us forty minutes to realise that we were bein' hunted. By that point, an encounter was inevitable. We setup a defensive position to stand our ground and braced ourselves for battle. Before long, we were bein' circled by three meat-eatin' dinosaurs. Although your typical theropods with wicked claws and sharp teeth, these ones also had a strange lil' hump over their hips. Didn't have the time to ponder what those might be for though, as moments after I spotted 'em, they charged to attack all at once.

trait.name: Wader
entries: Deinocheirus can move through water up to 6 ft. deep without being slowed or having to swim.

trait.name: Pennaceous Display Feathers
entries: Deinocheirus has advantage on Intimidation and Persuasion checks.

trait.name: Mud Raker
entries: If a single creature is hit by both of Deinocheirus' Terrible Claw attacks in a single turn, they suffer an additional {@damage 1d6} poison damage, as the dregged mud from its claws coats their wounds.

trait.name: Grasping Tongue
entries: As a bonus action, Deinocheirus may pick up and wield an item (up to 20 lb.) with its tongue. If that item is a weapon and does not require ammunition, it may make an attack with it as a bonus action on its subsequent turns, although it is not proficient with it.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: When selecting the attack action, Deinocheirus may make two Terrible Claw attacks.

action.name: Terrible Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 3d12 + 3}) slashing damage. A creature hit by this attack must succeed a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or drop an item they are wielding.

In the fetid swamp, we had the misfortune of havin' to wade through some pretty foul water. This was made all the more unpleasant by a huge oily, fuzzy, hump-backed theropod dinosaur that waded through the water. Thankfully, it was a herbivore, so there didn't appear to be any immediate danger of becomin' lunch. That said, it had some very mighty lookin' claws and could no doubt rend a person in two fairly easily. For that reason, and the smell, we kept our distance.

trait.name: Swamp Lord
entries: Deinocheirus gains resistance to cold and poison damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: When selecting the attack action, Deinocheirus may make two Terrible Claw attacks.

action.name: Terrible Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 3d12 + 3}) slashing damage. A creature hit by this attack must succeed a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or drop an item they are wielding.

action.name: Swampy Vomit {@recharge 5}
entries: As an action, Deinocheirus vomits swampy water in a 40 ft. line that is 5 ft. wide. Each creature in that line must succeed a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 4d8} poison damage and {@damage 4d8} bludgeoning damage. On a success they take half as much damage.

In the fetid swamp, we had the misfortune of havin' to wade through some pretty foul water. This was made all the more unpleasant by a huge oily, fuzzy, hump-backed theropod dinosaur that waded through the water. Thankfully, it was a herbivore, so there didn't appear to be any immediate danger of becomin' lunch. trait.name: Hyper Resilience
entries: Deinosuchus' remarkable immune system and colossal bulk render it resistant to all damage and it is immune to the {@condition poisoned} condition (included above).

trait.name: Devourer of Giants
entries: Any creature with a size of Large or larger makes saving throws at disadvantage against Deinosuchus' Bone-Crushing Bite.

trait.name: Aquatic Ambush Predator
entries: Deinosuchus can hold its breath for up to 1 hour and has advantage on Stealth checks while submerged in water.

action.name: Bone-Crushing Bite
entries: Deinosuchus may attempt a Bone-Crushing Bite against one creature within 10 ft. of it. This bite is so powerful that armour is essentially useless. The target creature must succeed a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw or take 56 ({@damage 8d10 + 12}) piercing damage, be {@condition grappled}, and {@condition restrained} (escape DC 20). Deinosuchus then cannot select a different target for Bone-Crushing Bite until the grapple ends.

legendary.name: Thrash
entries: Deinosuchus may thrash around wildly. All creatures within 10 ft. of it must succeed a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw or take 21 ({@damage 2d20}) bludgeoning damage. A creature {@condition grappled} by Deinosuchus may not attempt to save against this damage.

legendary.name: Deathroll
entries: If Deinosuchus is grappling another creature that is Large or larger, it may perform a Deathroll. The grappled creature must succeed a {@dc 21} Strength saving throw or take 39 ({@damage 6d12}) force damage. On a success, they take half as much damage. Deinosuchus cannot use Deathroll next round.

Most of us who adventure are familiar with crocs, big'uns too. But this this one was somethin' else. A gargantuan croc, far bigger than any other I've ever seen. Thankfully, we came upon it while it was baskin', rather than huntin'. It was so big that it was barely interested in us. I reckon it could take down even the biggest of dinosaurs with ease. Certainly wouldn't want to be on the receiving end of a bite from it. The heaviest plate armour wouldn't even make a difference.

trait.name: Hyper Resilience

trait.name: Regional Demigod
entries: Deinosuchus is worshiped by local humanoids as the embodiment of primal power and is accompanied by an entourage of humanoids that adorn it with giant flower rings, vividly coloured paints, and fine silks, and ritualistically clean its teeth as it basks in the sun.

Deinosuchus will not attack humanoids unless in self-defence and it is considered an extreme offence to these people to disrespect or attack Deinosuchus. Typically, these humanoids will demand an offering of food for Deinosuchus to safely pass through its territory.

trait.name: Top Triassic Predator
entries: Erythrosuchus was the top predator of its time, but only predated upon animals a similar size or smaller than itself. Erythrosuchus has advantage on attacks against Medium and Large creatures, but disadvantage on attacks against creatures of any other size category.

trait.name: Semi-arid Inhabitant
entries: Erythrosuchus only needs to drink water once every few weeks.

trait.name: Unknown Predatory Style
entries: If Erythrosuchus chooses the dash action, it may still make a single attack with its Monstrous Jaw as a bonus action.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (1/day)
entries: If Erythrosuchus fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: If Erythrosuchus chooses the attack action, it may make two Monstrous Jaw attacks.

action.name: Monstrous Jaw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) piercing damage. A creature hit by this attack is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 16}). While Erythrosuchus is grappling a creature, it can only target that creature with its attacks.

legendary.name: Ripping Thrash
entries: Erythrosuchus thrashes from side to side. If it is currently grappling a creature in its jaws, that creature must succeed a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or take {@damage 4d6} slashing damage. On a success, they take half as much damage.

legendary.name: Drag Away
entries: Erythrosuchus may move up to 20 ft., dragging a grappled creature along with it. Any creature grappled by Erythrosuchus is moved with it.

Travelin' through the desert, we had had three nights of restless campin'. The sounds of huge bellowin' creatures filled every night, making sleep difficult and worrisome. On the dawn of the fourth day, we had the misfortune to bein' awoken by one of the beasts tryin' to drag away our paladin. She, weirdly, sleeps in her armour and we had mocked her for it before. That night it likely saved her though. The thin' was huge and bizarre lookin'. It had a gigantic head with a fearsome bite, but smaller body  almost comical. As we struck at it, it thrashed from side to side, and opened its maw to bare its teeth  thankfully droppin' our friend.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (1/day)

trait.name: Maw of Madness
entries: Any creature hit by Erythrosuchus' Monstrous Jaw attack must succeed a {@dc 12} Wisdom saving throw or have their Intelligence score temporarily reduced to 3 for 1 minute. During this time, they may only act on instincts, their proficiency bonus is 0, and they cannot speak, read, write, or understand language.

As we struck at it, it thrashed from side to side, and opened its maw to bare its teeth  thankfully droppin' our friend.

trait.name: Fruitbringer
entries: When Falcatakely is first encountered, it will always carry a berry or fruit in its mouth. If players approach it, it will fly to a nearby tree or bush, revealing an abundance of delicious fruits/berries that can provide rations for four people for up to two days.

trait.name: Morning Chorus
entries: As dawn breaks, Falcatakely makes loud chirping noises that can be heard for up to 300 ft.

trait.name: Island Isolation
entries: Falcatakely found on an island will be different colours from, and produce a different chorus to, those found on the mainland.

action.name: Recurved Peck
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}1 ({@damage 1d2}) piercing damage.

The mornin' chorus in this region was much more vibrant than most areas. It didn't take long for us to find out why, since the culprit was such a beautiful beastie. A stunnin', vividly-patterned bird with a long curved beak. Friendly thin'  seemed to have a fondness of fruits if I recall.

trait.name: Fruitbringer
entries: When Falcatakely is first encountered, it will always carry a berry or fruit in its mouth. If players approach it, it will fly to a nearby tree or bush, revealing an abundance of delicious fruits/berries that can provide rations for four people for up to two days.

trait.name: Island Isolation
entries: Falcatakely found on an island will be different colours from, and produce a different chorus to, those found on the mainland.

trait.name: Bountiful Harvest
entries: Falcatakely radiate druidic energies and their presence increases the yield of all surrounding plants. If Falcatakely is present in an environment for more than a week, all plants in the local region double the amount of fruit, berries, and flowers they produce. This effect diminishes and productivity returns to normal over the course of a week if Falcatakely leaves the area.
Islands inhabited by colonies of many Falcatakely are usually tropical paradises.

trait.name: Familiar
entries: Falcatakely may be used as a familiar via the {@spell Find Familiar} spell or any similar effect. If you do so, we recommend that its Fruitbringer ability only activates each time it is summoned in a new area.

action.name: Recurved Peck

trait.name: Lock Jaw
entries: If Garjainia hits a creature with its Over-Sized Bite attack, it can opt to grasp onto it. While grasping, if either Garjainia or the hit creature attempts to move, they must make contested Strength checks. Whichever creature loses the contested Strength check has its speed reduced to 0 until its next turn. If Garjainia or the grasped creature moves, the other moves with it (without using any of its own movement) and is considered to be occupying the same space as it.

As an action, the hit creature may make a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw to remove Garjainia, ending this effect and pushing Garjainia 5 ft. directly away from it on a success. Alternatively, Garjainia may choose to end this effect at any time.

trait.name: High-Gait Scramble {@recharge 4}
entries: Garjainia can dash as a bonus action.

action.name: Over-Sized Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage.
When a creature is hit by this attack, roll a {@dice 1d3} and consult the list below, applying the effect to the hit creature so long as Garjainia is grasping it (see Lock Jaw):
1. Bitten body. The creature suffers an additional 4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage at the start of its turn.
2. Bitten arm. Melee, ranged, and spell attacks made by the creature are at disadvantage.
3. Bitten leg. Halve the current speed of the creature.
Garjainia can only cause one of these effects at a time.
One of the thin's I love most about our journeys is when we catch a glimpse of an animal and it doesn't know we're watchin' it.

trait.name: Swarm
entries: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Small beast. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

The swarm is immune to being {@condition charmed}, {@condition frightened}, {@condition grappled}, {@condition paralyzed}, {@condition petrified}, {@condition prone}, {@condition restrained}, and {@condition stunned} (included above).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: If Garjainia (Swarm) chooses the attack action, it may make four Over-Sized Bite attacks.

A group of Garjainia that aggregates to attack large prey, essentially forming a swarm capable of mobbing and disabling party members.

trait.name: Lock Jaw
entries: If Garjainia hits a creature with its Over-Sized Bite attack, it can opt to grasp onto it. While grasping, if either Garjainia or the hit creature attempts to move, they must make contested Strength checks. Whichever creature loses the contested Strength check has its speed reduced to 0 until its next turn. If Garjainia or the grasped creature moves, the other moves with it (without using any of its own movement) and is considered to be occupying the same space as it.

trait.name: Piranha-like Swarm
entries: If you wish, you may treat a group of 4-5 Garjainia as a CR 6 swarm (see the Garjainia (Swarm) stat block).

trait.name: Power Syphon
entries: Each time a creature is hit by Over-Sized Bite attack, roll a {@dice 1d20}. On a roll of 1-10, nothing happens. On a roll of 11-20, the hit creature expends one unused spell slot (determined at random).

trait.name: Overview
entries: Giraffatitan has advantage on Perception checks that involve sight.

trait.name: Enormous
entries: Giraffatitan has resistance to non-magical bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage (included above). Giraffatitan has advantage on saving throws to resist being knocked {@condition prone} and {@condition paralyzed}, but automatically fails any Dexterity saving throw.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: If Giraffatitan chooses the attack action, it may make one Neck Sweep attack and one Chomp attack.

action.name: Neck Sweep
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 15 ft., up to three targets. {@h}21 ({@damage 2d10 + 10}) bludgeoning damage. A creature hit by this attack must succeed a {@dc 18} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Chomp
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) piercing damage.

The heat had been gettin' to us pretty bad and we'd start'd to run low on water. Headin' down to the coast seemed like a good idea at the time. There, we could boil some of the salt water and condense out somethin' fresh to drink. At first, we couldn't make out the gigantic forms on the horizon. The blarin' sun hazin' our view. When we got a bit closer, we saw emtowerin' sauropods traipsin' through the waves to keep cool and scavengin' what few plants grew on the coast. Aproachin' was a bad decision. They was pretty defensive of their feedin' patch and boy, those things can't half give ya a whack when they wanna.

Alternatively, instead of using the Minor Mutation Table you may increase the range of both of Giraffatitan's attacks by 5 ft.
Giraffatitan gains the mutation or increased attack range for 1 hour.

trait.name: Bipedal Shift
entries: If Iguanodon chooses the Dash action, its base speed is increased to 40 ft. until the start of its next turn (dashing up to 80 ft.).

trait.name: Bellow Cheeks
entries: As a bonus action, Iguanodon may inflate its cheeks and create a loud bellowing sound. If it does, all other Iguanodon within 500 ft. become aware that it is in danger and will either flock to help, or flee the area.

trait.name: Ossified Tendons
entries: Iguanodon has advantage on Strength saving throws.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: If Iguanodon chooses the attack action, it may make two Thumb Gore attacks and one Bulk Throw attack.

action.name: Thumb Gore
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Bulk Throw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) bludgeoning damage. Iguanodon throws its weight around. A creature hit by this attack must succeed a {@dc 12} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If Iguanodon misses with this attack, it must succeed a {@dc 10} Dexterity saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

One of the more common dinosaurs we encountered was those large ornithopods, Iguanodon. Easily recognisable by their large thumb spikes and grumpy attitude, they were a staple prey for all of the big predators in this area but rarely moved alone. If you wanted to pick a fight with one, you'd usually end up outnumbered. Fine if you're a big predatory dinosaur, less fine if you're a lil' adventurer. Despite their moderate size compared to other dinosaurs, these thin's were still pretty dangerous when they heft their weight around.

trait.name: Bipedal Shift

trait.name: Bellow Cheeks

trait.name: Crystal Palace Horned History
entries: You may choose for Iguanodon to have a much more lizard-like appearance and a large, pointed horn on its snout instead of clawed thumbs. If you do, replace all instances of "Thumb Gore" in its stat block with "Horn Gore".

trait.name: The Bone Wars
entries: One of two greedy palaeontologists (Marsh or Cope) refuse to allow anyone to study Iguanodon's remains and have hidden explosives on every member of this species. If Iguanodon is slain, do not end combat. A loud ticking sound can be heard emanating from its remains and, after 2 rounds, they detonate with a large explosion.

Each creature within a 15 ft. radius of Iguanodon's remains must succeed a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 3d6} fire damage and {@damage 3d6} bludgeoning damage. On a success they take half as much damage. Iguanodon's remains are then completely destroyed and irrecoverable.

trait.name: Nocturnal
entries: Juravenator has darkvision 120 ft. (included above) and can see as if in bright light up to 60 ft. It is generally only active at night.

trait.name: Fatty Water-Wader
entries: Juravenator has resistance to cold damage (included above) and advantage on attacks against creatures submerged in water that are smaller than itself.

trait.name: Quick Reflexes
entries: Juravenator can dash as a bonus action and has advantage on Dexterity saving throws and checks.

action.name: Quick Snap
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}1 ({@damage 1d2}) piercing damage.

The third night that we camped along the riverbank, I was on first watch. After a few hours, I could feel myself noddin' off, so wandered down to the river's edge to splash myself with some water. It were deathly quiet, bar the chirpin' of crickets. As I crouched down into the water, I saw the shine of a tiny pair of eyes off in the reeds a few feet ahead. It was some kind of small theropod pluckin' minnows out of the water. I took a step forward to try and get a closer look, but the slosh of me foot spooked it, and it darted off into the night.

trait.name: Adult Form: Borb
entries: Juravenator has a chubby and puffed-up feathered appearance. Its hit points are doubled, movement speed is doubled, to-hit bonus is doubled, and its damage becomes {@dice 1d4}. Juravenator gains resistance to bludgeoning damage and its size category is Small.

trait.name: Familiar
entries: Alternatively, you can choose to not increase Juravenator's CR and remove the Adult Form: Borb optional rule. Juravenator may then be used as a familiar via the {@spell Find Familiar} spell or any similar effect. If you wish, it may still maintain the appearance described in Adult Form: Borb.

trait.name: Reactionary Strike
entries: When Kentrosaurus is hit by a melee attack, it can use its reaction to make a single Thagomise attack at the creature that attacked it.

trait.name: Sexually Dimorphic
entries: Male and female Kentrosaurus differ in appearance. In a herd of 3 or more Kentrosaurus, select 1-2 animals to be male. They are a different colour than the females.

trait.name: Vicious Defences
entries: A creature damaged by an attack made by Kentrosaurus using its Reactionary Strike must succeed a {@dc 14} Charisma saving throw or become {@condition frightened} of Kentrosaurus for 1 minute. At the end of that creature's turn, it may repeat the saving throw. On a successful save it is no longer {@condition frightened} of Kentrosaurus and is immune to Vicious Defences for 24 hours.

trait.name: Anterior-Facing Spikes
entries: A creature attacking Kentrosaurus does not gain advantage for any ability or effect that would grant them advantage on attacks for outnumbering or flanking Kentrosaurus.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: When Kentrosaurus chooses the attack action, it can make two Thagomise attacks, or a single Tailsweep attack.

action.name: Thagomise
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d12 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Tailsweep
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft., up to three targets. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) piercing damage. A creature hit by this attack must succeed a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

We suggest Kentrosaurus be portrayed as a gregarious (grouping) animal, moving in small herds between feeding spots. When encountered by a party, they should be alert but not necessarily aggressive, with the dominant animal making its presence clear and visible.

trait.name: The Hoodening
entries: Channelling Kentish folklore, Kentrosaurus is able to magically disguise itself as a horse. It will appear to be a wild horse to any observer. The disguise can be discerned by a DC 15 Investigation check, or is revealed when Kentrosaurus attacks.

While Kentrosaurus is disguised as a horse, any creature that attempts to mount or ride it suffers {@damage 2d10} piercing damage and the disguise is revealed. If a creature otherwise attempts to touch Kentrosaurus, they take {@damage 1d4} piercing damage and are made aware that something is amiss.

trait.name: Snatch Feeder
entries: If Klobiodon is flying, it does not provoke attacks of opportunity when it moves out of an enemy's reach.

trait.name: Tooth Cage
entries: If Klobiodon hits a creature with its Toothed Gnaw attack, Klobiodon can opt to grasp onto it. Whenever that creature moves, Klobiodon moves with it (without using any of its own movement) and is considered to be occupying the same space as it. While grasping onto a creature, Klobiodon's AC is 10.

As an action, the hit creature may make a {@dc 8} Strength saving throw to remove Klobiodon, ending this effect and pushing Klobiodon 5 ft. directly away from it on a success. Alternatively, Klobiodon may choose to end this effect at any time.

A creature with Klobiodon grasping onto it has its movement speed reduced by 5 ft. and takes {@damage 1d2} piercing damage at the start of its turn. These effects are cumulative if more than one Klobiodon is grasping a single creature.

action.name: Toothed Gnaw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}2 ({@damage 1d4}) piercing damage.

This whole area was filled with lil' fish-snatching pterosaurs. They kept their distance from us  I guess they're used to being plucked off of the ground by small predators. Still, beautiful creatures to see flyin' and fascinatin' to observe perchin' on rocks. They fed by flyin' low over the water and quickly dippin' their heads in, nabbin' unaware fish. Nifty stuff.

trait.name: Hiding in Plain Sight
entries: Klobiodon's fossils sat unassigned to a new species for decades in a museum drawer. As long as Klobiodon is motionless, it is invisible. In the first round of combat, if Klobiodon was invisible at the start of the round, its Toothed Gnaw deals an additional {@damage 1d4} piercing damage this round.

trait.name: River Skulker
entries: Kulindadromeus has advantage on Stealth checks while in thick foliage and can attempt to hide in sparse foliage or shallow water that would normally be too exposed to hide in. It also has darkvision 40 ft. and a passive Perception of 16 (both included above).

trait.name: Protofeathered Wader
entries: Reduce any cold damage Kulindadromeus takes by {@dice 1d4} and it is not slowed by muddy difficult terrain.

action.name: Beaked Chomp
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

One of the thin's I love most about our journeys is when we catch a glimpse of an animal and it doesn't know we're watchin' it. We get to see thin's that no one else has ever seen. We spotted one lil' group of ornithopod dinosaurs in a small forest clearin', preparin' to make nests. They were kickin' back the leaf litter and usin' their lil' beaks to pick up the remainin' leaves. Covered in soft downy fuzz, they were the cutest lil' critters you could imagine, peepin' away at each other as they squabbled for space.

trait.name: River Skulker
entries: Kulindadromeus has advantage on Stealth checks while in thick foliage and can attempt to hide in sparse foliage or shallow water that would normally be too exposed to hide in. It also has darkvision 40 ft. and a passive Perception of 16 (both included above).

trait.name: Protofeathered Wader
entries: Reduce any cold damage Kulindadromeus takes by {@dice 1d4} and it is not slowed by muddy difficult terrain.

trait.name: Progenitor of Giants
entries: Kulindadromeus is among the first of the major herbivore lineage Ornithischia. All other herbivores within this lineage (Heterodontosaurs, Stegosaurs, Ankylosaurs, Iguanodontids, Hadrosaurs, etc. (e.g. Bolong (48), Iguanodon (135), Kentrosaurus (139), Scelidosaurus (172), Struthiosaurus (93), and Zuul (188) in this book)) treat Kulindadromeus as a close relative and will protect it with their lives. They will ward off any threats to Kulindadromeus and ensure that it can feed safely.

trait.name: Deep Diver
entries: Leptonectes can hold its breath for 2 hours and has resistance to cold and thunder damage (included above).

trait.name: Large Fusiform
entries: While in water, Leptonectes cannot be {@condition grappled} by creatures smaller than itself and is immune to the spell {@spell Tidal Wave} (or similar effects).

action.name: Snout Skewer
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d4 + 2}) piercing damage.
If Leptonectes swam at least 40 ft. in a straight line before using this attack this turn, it deals an additional {@damage 2d6} piercing damage.

action.name: Giant Paddle Slap
entries: Each other creature within 5 ft. of Leptonectes must succeed a {@dc 11} Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 1d8} bludgeoning damage and {@damage 1d8} thunder damage.

After a couple days at sea, I'd become restless in the night and decided to sit up on deck for a few hours. The calm breeze blowin' and rockin' boat was pretty soothin'. I noticed the sound of rollin' splashes starboard and decided to take a peek. The waters were dully lit by bioluminescent jellies and in the murk, I could see several large dolphin-like shapes dartin' between the shadows and occasionally snappin' up a jelly or two. They were ichthyosaurs, feedin' in the moonlight and unbothered by our presence.

If Leptonectes swam at least 40 ft. in a straight line before using this attack this turn, it deals an additional {@damage 2d6} piercing damage.

action.name: Giant Paddle Slap
entries: Each other creature within 5 ft. of Leptonectes must succeed a {@dc 11} Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 1d8} bludgeoning damage and {@damage 1d8} thunder damage.

legendary.name: Sneering Swipe
entries: Leptonectes may swim up to 5 ft. then make a Snout Skewer attack (this attack cannot benefit from the additional damage).

After a couple days at sea, I'd become restless in the night and decided to sit up on deck for a few hours. The calm breeze blowin' and rockin' boat was pretty soothin'. I noticed the sound of rollin' splashes starboard and decided to take a peek. The waters were dully lit by bioluminescent jellies and in the murk, I could see several large dolphin-like shapes dartin' between the shadows and occasionally snappin' up a jelly or two. They were ichthyosaurs, feedin' in the moonlight and unbothered by our presence.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: Mastodonsaurus can breathe in both air and water. When in water, it gains a +3 bonus to Dexterity saving throws.

trait.name: Dermal Pressure Sensors
entries: While in water, Mastodonsaurus has a blindsight of 30 ft. (included above).

trait.name: Perfect Ambusher
entries: While motionless at the bottom of a body of water, Mastodonsaurus is indistinguishable from the sediment. If it attacks from this position, it is always considered to be first in the initiative order (regardless of all other abilities, like the Alert feat), has advantage on its first attack, and that attack deals an additional {@damage 1d10} piercing damage.

action.name: Tusked Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d10 + 6}) piercing damage.
A creature hit by this attack is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 14}).

The swamps are a particularly dangerous place to venture. Not only are they slow to wade through, but many nasty predators hide in the murky waters. One of the scarier ones is a giant amphibian that lies in wait, fully submerged and totally indistinguishable from the mud its squalorin' in. Those who have the misfortune to step too close are met with an explosion of tusked fury  water flyin' everywhere. Ambushes like this were painfully common and we lost a few good adventurers over the course of the weeks spent there.

trait.name: Gurgling Energies
entries: When a creature is hit by Tusked Bite, it must succeed a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 1d8} damage. Roll a {@dice 1d4} and consult the list below to determine the type of damage this ability deals. Additionally, Mastodonsaurus gains immunity to that damage type until its next turn.
{@dice 1d4} | Type
1 | Fire
2 | Cold
3 | Lightning
4 | Force

A creature hit by this attack is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 14}).

Ambushes like this were painfully common and we lost a few good adventurers over the course of the weeks spent there.

trait.name: King of its Time
entries: Megalosaurus was the arch-predator of the British Bathonian. It has advantage on attacks against creatures that are the same size category as itself.

trait.name: Scrotum humanum
entries: Megalosaurus takes triple damage from the cantrip {@spell Vicious Mockery}.

action.name: Combination Multiattack
entries: If Megalosaurus chooses the attack action, it may make two Predatory Strike attacks. However, each of those Predatory Strike attacks must choose a different damage type.

action.name: Predatory Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) damage (see below).

Megalosaurus lashes out with one of its myriad attacks - headbutting, clawing, biting, or lashing with its tail. When making a Predatory Strike, you can select either bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing as the damage type.

legendary.name: Rampant Thrashing
entries: Megalosaurus disengages and may move up to 10 ft.

legendary.name: Predatory Gile
entries: Megalosaurus positions itself to take down a target. Choose a creature it can see. If its next attack hits that creature, that creature is also knocked {@condition prone}.

This is a beast that I'd read lots about in the ancient libraries of my university  the first dinosaur fossil ever described by scientists. When we first sighted it, I was all giddy with excitement. But, nothin' prepared me for how magnificent and deadly it was. It attacked without warnin' and unleashed a flurry of claws, teeth, kicks, and tail swipes. We were able to fend it off with some cold steel, but our cleric had a hearty job of healin' us up afterwards.

trait.name: King of its Time
entries: Megalosaurus was the arch-predator of the British Bathonian. It has advantage on attacks against creatures that are the same size category as itself.

trait.name: Scrotum humanum
entries: Megalosaurus takes triple damage from the cantrip {@spell Vicious Mockery}.

trait.name: First of its Kind
entries: The first time a humanoid (including player characters) sees Megalosaurus while within 60 ft. of it, they are affected by a curse that causes them to momentarily lose all understanding of dinosaurs and other Mesozoic creatures (no save allowed). The curse persists for two rounds or until they take damage. For each creature afflicted, roll a {@dice 1d4} and consult the table below to determine how they behave:
1. Curious - The humanoid becomes unaware of any threat Megalosaurus poses. They cannot attack it or cast detrimental spells/cantrips against it and must move directly towards it if possible.

2. Threatened - On the humanoid's next turn, they must make a ranged or melee attack against Megalosaurus or cast a cantrip that targets it. If the humanoid has Multiattack, they instead only make a single attack.

3. Adoring - The humanoid must attempt to feed or heal Megalosaurus on their next turn. Megalosaurus can accept food as a reaction and will then prioritise killing other creatures over any that have fed it or healed it.
4. Terrified - The humanoid becomes {@condition frightened} of Megalosaurus.

trait.name: Speciose
entries: Early Titanosaurs diversified rapidly. Each time the party encounters a new Mnyamawamtuka (including this one), select or roll for an adaptation on the Minor Mutation Table (page 218). Apply that mutation to that Mnyamawamtuka. You do not need to increase Mnyamawamtuka's CR for the mutation gained.

trait.name: Columnar Limbs
entries: Mnyamawamtuka's strong legs make it exceedingly difficult to topple. It has an additional +5 modifier and advantage on saving throws to avoid being knocked {@condition prone}. However, Mnyamawamtuka has a further -3 modifier (total -5, included above) and disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: If Mnyamawamtuka chooses the attack action, it may make one Shovelling Bite attack and two Whipping Tail attacks.

action.name: Shovelling Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage.
Mnyamawamtuka's semi-spatulate shaped teeth pull at any target they bite. A creature hit by this attack must succeed a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or drop an item it is wielding.

action.name: Whipping Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) slashing damage.

Among our travels we had seen myriad behaviours of various dinosaurs, includin' complex matin' rituals. None were so excitin' as these huge sauropods. They pranced around each other with uncharacteristic grace in a wonderful' ballet that had no doubt been practiced hundreds of times. When we encounter such a thin', we stay to watch but ensure never to interfere. That policy gifted us their complete matin' ritual and it was well worth our patience.

trait.name: Heart-Shaped Soul
entries: Any creature hit by an attack from Mnyamawamtuka must succeed a {@dc 10} Charisma saving throw or be {@condition charmed} by Mnyamawamtuka for 1 minute, fetching food for it. If the charmed creature takes any damage, the effect ends. Once this charm wears off or is removed, the creature cannot be affected by this ability again for 24 hours. Mnyamawamtuka prioritises attacking non-charmed creatures.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: If Mnyamawamtuka chooses the attack action, it may make one Shovelling Bite attack and two Whipping Tail attacks.

trait.name: Diver
entries: Mosasaurus can hold its breath for up to 2 hours.

trait.name: Ocean Tyrant
entries: Mosasaurus has advantage on Mighty Jaw attacks against other creatures native to an ocean setting.

trait.name: Stormrider
entries: Mosasaurus has resistance to cold, lightning, and thunder damage (included above).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: If Mosasaurus chooses the attack action, it may make one Mighty Jaw attack and one Concussive Splash attack.

action.name: Mighty Jaw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}28 ({@damage 4d8 + 10}) piercing damage.
Any target hit by this attack must succeed a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or take an additional {@damage 2d8} piercing damage from Mosasaurus' palatal teeth.

action.name: Concussive Splash
entries: Each creature in a 20 ft. cone in front of Mosasaurus must succeed a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or take 16 ({@damage 3d6 + 6}) thunder damage. On a success they take half as much damage.

Sailin' on the ancient sea ain't without its dangers. All the usual monsters still haunt the deep oceans, but there's also some pretty mean reptiles that swim the surfaces too. Durin' one stormy night, we sighted a huge one breach  its slick body glistening in the moonlight. It seemed completely unphased by the bad weather and was probably scoutin' us out  figurin' out what our ship was and whether it could eat us. If someone had fallen in, I'm sure they wouldn't have stood a chance.

action.name: Rogue Wave {@recharge 4}
entries: Once a storm has been summoned, as an action, Mosasaurus can cast {@spell Tidal Wave} without requiring a spell slot or components. Additionally, Mosasaurus itself is immune to the effects of {@spell Tidal Wave}. Mosasaurus can only use Rogue Wave up to four times per day.

Durin' one stormy night, we sighted a huge one breach  its slick body glistening in the moonlight. It seemed completely unphased by the bad weather and was probably scoutin' us out  figurin' out what our ship was and whether it could eat us. If someone had fallen in, I'm sure they wouldn't have stood a chance.

trait.name: Ocean Farer
entries: Nothosaurus has resistance to cold and thunder damage (included above).

trait.name: Diverse
entries: Nothosaurus come in a variety of colours with different skin patterns.

trait.name: Aquatic Reptile
entries: Nothosaurus can hold its breath for up to 10 minutes and has advantage on Dexterity saving throws while submerged in water.

trait.name: Basking
entries: If Nothosaurus spends at least 10 minutes basking in the sun on land, it gains immunity to cold damage for 1 hour.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: When Nothosaurus chooses the attack action, it may make two Piercing Bite attacks and one Neck Whack attack.

action.name: Piercing Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Neck Whack
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

legendary.name: Dive
entries: Nothosaurus swims up to 15 ft.

The beach was a raucous place. Along the rocks and shingle there were dozens of large four-flippered reptiles baskin'. They were makin' loud low grumbles that echoed off the cliffs. I reckon they were complain' to each other about the lack of space on the best rocks and some were pushin' and shovin'. They were cumbersome on land, but the ones out at sea were rollin' with the waves with ease, usin' their protrudin' teeth to snatch fish.
