They were cumbersome on land, but the ones out at sea were rollin' with the waves with ease, usin' their protrudin' teeth to snatch fish.

trait.name: Handless
entries: Nyctosaurus has only one finger on each hand, which is utilised by its wing to support the membrane. It cannot climb any surface.

trait.name: Inter-Continental Migrator
entries: Nyctosaurus can fly for up to a week without needing to stop. It can sleep while flying, although its fly speed is reduced to 30 ft., and it can only fly in a straight line while it does so.

trait.name: Snatch Feeder
entries: If Nyctosaurus is flying, it does not provoke attacks of opportunity when it moves out of an enemy's reach.

action.name: Headcrest 'Antler' Crash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) piercing damage.
Nyctosaurus may only perform this attack if it flew at least 50 ft. this turn.
When Nyctosaurus makes this attack, it lands on the ground.

action.name: Beaked Peck
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

Sometimes you see somethin' that makes you double-take. While hikin' up a cliff, we spotted a small group of pterosaurs circling below. They were using the air currents to gain altitude. It took 'em a few minutes to rise, but as they passed us, we saw that they had the strangest huge Y-shaped crests protrudin' from the backs of their heads. How the hell they could fly with such unwieldly ornamentation is beyond me, but they were!

Nyctosaurus has a blindsight of 60 ft.

trait.name: Aura of Blindsight
entries: Any other friendly Nyctosaurus that starts its turn within or moves within 100 ft. of this Nyctosaurus gains a blindsight of 10 ft. for 1 minute if it was not already using these optional magical rules.

How the hell they could fly with such unwieldly ornamentation is beyond me, but they were!

trait.name: Brooder
entries: Oviraptor are excellent parents and fiercely territorial of their nests. If Oviraptor is defending its nest, it attacks recklessly, giving it advantage on all attacks, but all attacks against it also have advantage.

trait.name: Crested Head Flush (1/day)
entries: As a bonus action, Oviraptor can flush its crest with blood, giving it a vivid appearance. It gains advantage on Charisma checks and Charisma saving throws for the next 1 minute.

trait.name: Feathered
entries: When hit by an attack, Oviraptor can use its reaction to reduce any incoming bludgeoning damage by {@dice 1d4}. When taking falling damage, Oviraptor can use its reaction to reduce the falling damage it takes by {@dice 2d10}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: When choosing the attack action, Oviraptor may make one Snapping Beak attack and one Clawed Scratch attack.

action.name: Snapping Beak
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Clawed Scratch
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) slashing damage.

We had started to run low on rations while trekkin' through the badlands. We had made sure we had surplus water, but food was the problem. After a few more hours of walkin' with growlin' stomachs, we encountered a series of nests guarded by honkin' squawkin' beaked gangly theropods. There was a wealth of eggs, but I knew we'd be in for a fierce fight to get 'em. Still, hunger pushes a man to do dangerous thin's.

trait.name: Egg/Offspring Thief
entries: The original misinterpretation of Oviraptor as opportunistic egg thieves, when all evidence shows that they were actually attentive parents has left a bitter resentment within all Oviraptor.

These creatures will now steal eggs and/or young of other species (including humanoids), but rather than devouring them, will instead care for them diligently and raise them as their own. Oviraptor gains proficiency in Stealth checks while stealing offspring.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: When choosing the attack action, Oviraptor may make one Snapping Beak attack and one Clawed Scratch attack.

action.name: Snapping Beak
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Clawed Scratch
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) slashing damage.

After a few more hours of walkin' with growlin' stomachs, we encountered a series of nests guarded by honkin' squawkin' beaked gangly theropods. There was a wealth of eggs, but I knew we'd be in for a fierce fight to get 'em. Still, hunger pushes a man to do dangerous thin's.

trait.name: Filter-Feeder
entries: Pterodaustro cannot be {@condition poisoned} or damaged by contaminated or laced food or water.

trait.name: Quad-Launch (Pterodaustro)
entries: If not already flying, as a bonus action, Pterodaustro can launch itself into the air. Every other creature within 5 ft. of it must succeed a {@dc 8} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. Pterodaustro then begins to fly and must fly 10 ft. in a straight line (either horizontally, or vertically up).
Pterodaustro can only begin flying by using this ability, or if it is falling.

trait.name: Group Sentinel
entries: If three or more Pterodaustro are together, select one of them to be the Group Sentinel. That Pterodaustro has advantage on Perception checks.

action.name: Wing-Buffet
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

Not all of our adventures were bombastic fights of life'n'death. Some days we really were just able to enjoy the sights. One warm evenin', while the sun was settin', we were relaxin' on a lakeside. We watched a flock of a dozen pterosaurs wadin' just off the shore. They had heads like upturned hairbrushes and were filterin' the water through their bristle-like teeth. With each slosh, they pulled small invertebrates out of the silt and gobbled 'em down. The sound of the water lappin' as they fed was so soothin', it almost put me to sleep right then and there.

trait.name: Filter-Feeder

Pterodaustro can only begin flying by using this ability, or if it is falling.

trait.name: Group Sentinel

trait.name: Swallowed Gemstone
entries: When encountering a group of Pterodaustro, one or more of them may be enchanted with a magical element from a gemstone they have swallowed. That Pterodaustro will glow with a soft hue and the damage type of its attacks will change to the corresponding type for that gemstone. You may roll a {@dice 1d10} or select from the table below to determine the gemstone swallowed, colour hue, and damage type:
{@dice 1d10} | Gemstone, Colour, Type
1 | Ruby, Red, Fire
2 | Sapphire, Sky Blue, Cold
3 | Topaz, Yellow, Lightning
4 | Augite, Black, Poison
5 | Jade, Green, Acid
6 | Tanzanite, Cerulean, Thunder
7 | Citrine, Golden, Radiant
8 | Amethyst, Purple, Psychic
9 | Malachite, Viridian, Necrotic
10 | Labradorite, Iridescent Rainbow, Force
When Pterodaustro is slain, the gemstone it swallowed is regurgitated (worth 50 gp).

action.name: Wing-Buffet
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

Not all of our adventures were bombastic fights of life'n'death. Some days we really were just able to enjoy the sights. One warm evenin', while the sun was settin', we were relaxin' on a lakeside. We watched a flock of a dozen pterosaurs wadin' just off the shore. They had heads like upturned hairbrushes and were filterin' the water through their bristle-like teeth. With each slosh, they pulled small invertebrates out of the silt and gobbled 'em down. The sound of the water lappin' as they fed was so soothin', it almost put me to sleep right then and there.

trait.name: Quad Launch (Quetzalcoatlus)
entries: If not already flying, as a bonus action, Quetzalcoatlus can launch itself into the air. Every other creature within 10 ft. of it must succeed a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. Quetzalcoatlus then begins to fly and must fly 20 ft. in a straight line (either horizontally, or vertically up).
Quetzalcoatlus can only begin flying by using this ability, or if it is falling.

trait.name: Stalking Stalk, Silent Glider
entries: If Quetzalcoatlus is walking within a forest or is flying, it has advantage on Stealth checks.

trait.name: Vicious Descent
entries: If Quetzalcoatlus began the turn flying and subsequently lands before making an attack, increase the damage of its first Colossal Peck attack by {@damage 1d10} this turn.

trait.name: Eye in the Sky
entries: While flying, Quetzalcoatlus has advantage on Perception checks that involve sight.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: When Quetzalcoatlus chooses the attack action, it may make three Colossal Peck attacks.

action.name: Colossal Peck
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 2d10 + 8}) piercing damage.
If a creature hit by this attack is Medium or Small in size, it must succeed a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Thunderous Flap {@recharge 5}
entries: Each creature within a 15 ft. radius in front of Quetzalcoatlus (a semi-circle with the centre of the flat edge positioned on Quetzalcoatlus) must succeed a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or take 17 ({@damage 5d6}) bludgeoning and 17 ({@damage 5d6}) thunder damage. On a success they take half as much damage.

Few thin's compare to the monumental sight of a full-grown Quetz soarin' above. While sailin' along the coast we had the opportunity to witness their annual migration, with several spotted each day. Their huge blade-like wings let 'em glide effortlessly over the waters, as they made their way to their inland nestin' grounds. Biggest flyin' thin' I ever saw. We caught the sight of a couple more many hundreds of feet up too  tiny shapes that lost all sense of scale in the endless sky.

trait.name: Eye in the Sky
entries: While flying, Quetzalcoatlus has advantage on Perception checks that involve sight.

trait.name: Low-Gravity Aura
entries: Quetzalcoatlus drastically reduces the weight of objects and creatures in contact with it (including itself). A real Quetzalcoatlus would usually be able to carry a maximum weight of about 80-100 lb. This ability increases its carry weight limit to 500 lb. and any howdah or saddle attached to it are considered weightless for the purposes of its carry weight. For each 100 lb. Quetzalcoatlus is carrying, reduce its fly speed by 10 ft.

trait.name: Aircraft-Sized Animal
entries: Quetzalcoatlus can carry up to three Medium (or smaller) humanoids on its back, and two further Medium (or smaller) humanoids in its hind claws. For each creature carried in this way, Quetzalcoatlus' fly speed is reduced by 10 ft.
If Quetzalcoatlus is carrying two or more creatures using this rule, it cannot use its Lift Off action.

trait.name: Feathered God
entries: You may choose for Quetzalcoatlus to be covered in vivid feathers.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: When Quetzalcoatlus chooses the attack action, it may make three Colossal Peck attacks.

action.name: Colossal Peck
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 2d10 + 8}) piercing damage.
If a creature hit by this attack is Medium or Small in size, it must succeed a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Thunderous Flap {@recharge 5}
entries: Each creature within a 15 ft. radius in front of Quetzalcoatlus (a semi-circle with the centre of the flat edge positioned on Quetzalcoatlus) must succeed a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or take 17 ({@damage 5d6}) bludgeoning and 17 ({@damage 5d6}) thunder damage. On a success they take half as much damage.

action.name: Lift Off
entries: While flying, as an action, Quetzalcoatlus may pick up an object (usually) weighing up to 500 lb. and up to Large in size. While carrying this object, its fly speed is reduced by 10 ft. for each 100 lb. the object weighs.

Quetzalcoatlus may drop a carried object at any point during its turn. If this object is dropped on a creature, that creature must succeed a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 2d10} bludgeoning damage for each 100 lb. the object weighs. If the object is dropped from 50 ft. or higher, the bludgeoning damage is doubled, but the Dexterity saving throw DC is reduced to 12.

Few thin's compare to the monumental sight of a full-grown Quetz soarin' above. While sailin' along the coast we had the opportunity to witness their annual migration, with several spotted each day. Their huge blade-like wings let 'em glide effortlessly over the waters, as they made their way to their inland nestin' grounds. Biggest flyin' thin' I ever saw. We caught the sight of a couple more many hundreds of feet up too  tiny shapes that lost all sense of scale in the endless sky.

trait.name: Morbid Regurgitation
entries: Rhamphorhynchus vomits up its stomach contents upon death. When Rhamphorhynchus dies, one creature within 5 ft. must succeed a {@dc 8} Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 1d4} acid damage.

trait.name: Swooping Evasion
entries: If Rhamphorhynchus is flying, it can use its reaction to increase its AC by 3 when an enemy makes an attack of opportunity against it.
Rhamphorhynchus can use its reaction to give itself advantage on any Dexterity saving throw when forced to make one.

trait.name: Growth Spurt
entries: Rhamphorhynchus can be found as either a juvenile (Tiny) or adult (Small) creature.

action.name: Spike-Toothed Snap
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) piercing damage.

These tiny lil' pterosaurs are such a pain. They're highly inquisitive and have a nasty habit of snatchin' stuff right out of your hands. I guess they're used to grabbin' food, since they sometimes swallow the stuff without even thinkin'. Reminds me of herring gulls back in our time. Difference is, herring gulls ain't armed with dozens of protrudin' teeth! The hatchlin's of this species are gregarious  they find safety in numbers and bunch up into swarms. They get pretty hungry too and anyone carryin' food tends to get mobbed pretty quick. For somethin' so small, they can be quite fearsome in numbers. Almost like lil' angry flyin' piranhas.

trait.name: Morbid Regurgitation
entries: Rhamphorhynchus vomits up its stomach contents upon death. When Rhamphorhynchus dies, one creature within 5 ft. must succeed a {@dc 8} Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 1d4} acid damage.

entries: If Rhamphorhynchus is flying, it can use its reaction to increase its AC by 3 when an enemy makes an attack of opportunity against it.
Rhamphorhynchus can use its reaction to give itself advantage on any Dexterity saving throw when forced to make one.

trait.name: Growth Spurt
entries: Rhamphorhynchus can be found as either a juvenile (Tiny) or adult (Small) creature.

trait.name: Snatch & Swallow
entries: When hitting with its Spike-Toothed Snap attack, Rhamphorhynchus may opt to deal no damage and instead try to snatch and swallow a small item (trinket, potion, wand, dagger, etc.) that it can see on the hit creature. The hit creature must succeed a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw or have the item snatched and swallowed by Rhamphorhynchus.
If the item is magical, Spike-Toothed Snap becomes a magical attack and deals a damage type appropriate to the item (i.e., a swallowed Wand of Magic Missile changes it to force damage).
If the item provides healing (i.e., a healing potion), Rhamphorhynchus gains {@dice 1d4 + 2} temporary hit points.
Any swallowed non-food or non-potion item is regurgitated upon Rhamphorhynchus' death, and potions are regurgitated as empty vials.

action.name: Spike-Toothed Snap

trait.name: Morbid Regurgitation (Swarm)
entries: Each time Rhamphorhynchus (Swarm) drops below the hit point thresholds of 34, 24, 14, and 4, one of its members vomits up its stomach contents. One creature within 5 ft. of Rhamphorhynchus (Swarm) must succeed a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 1d4} acid damage.

trait.name: Swarming Flurry
entries: Melee attacks against Rhamphorhynchus (Swarm) are made at disadvantage.

trait.name: Naive Juveniles
entries: This swarm is composed entirely of inexperienced juvenile animals. It has disadvantage on Wisdom saving throws.

trait.name: Swarm
entries: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny beast. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

The swarm is immune to being {@condition charmed}, {@condition frightened}, {@condition grappled}, {@condition paralyzed}, {@condition petrified}, {@condition prone}, {@condition restrained}, and {@condition stunned} (included above).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Whenever Rhamphorhynchus (Swarm) chooses the attack action, it can make up to five Spike-Toothed Snap attacks.

action.name: Spike-Toothed Snap
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) piercing damage.
A swarm of juvenile Rhamphorhynchus that mob intruders in a frenzied mass of teeth and wings. Almost like lil' angry flyin' piranhas.

entries: Each time Rhamphorhynchus (Swarm) drops below the hit point thresholds of 34, 24, 14, and 4, one of its members vomits up its stomach contents. One creature within 5 ft. of Rhamphorhynchus (Swarm) must succeed a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 1d4} acid damage.

The swarm is immune to being {@condition charmed}, {@condition frightened}, {@condition grappled}, {@condition paralyzed}, {@condition petrified}, {@condition prone}, {@condition restrained}, and {@condition stunned} (included above).

trait.name: Enchanted Swarm
entries: Rhamphorhynchus (Swarm) has already snatched dozens of magical items and incorporated them into their attacks. Each time Rhamphorhynchus swarm makes a Spike-Toothed Snap attack, you may roll a {@dice 1d10} and change the damage type of the attack according to the list below:
{@dice 1d10} | Damage Type
1 | Fire
2 | Cold
3 | Lightning
4 | Poison
5 | Force
6 | Psychic
7 | Thunder
8 | Necrotic
9 | Acid
10 | Radiant

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Whenever Rhamphorhynchus (Swarm) chooses the attack action, it can make up to five Spike-Toothed Snap attacks.

entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) piercing damage.
A swarm of juvenile Rhamphorhynchus that mob intruders in a frenzied mass of teeth and wings. This enchanted swarm has incorporated dozens of stolen magical items into their attacks.

trait.name: Razor Osteoderms
entries: Any creature that hits Scelidosaurus with a melee attack suffers {@damage 1d6} slashing damage. Scelidosaurus may use its reaction to increase this to {@damage 2d4} slashing damage.
Scelidosaurus is resistant to non-magical bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage (included above).

trait.name: Oblivious
entries: Scelidosaurus automatically fails any Intelligence saving throws.

action.name: Serrated Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

We'd been travellin' through that accursed forest for days, barely able to see the sky through the thick canopy. When we reached the forest edge, the burstin' blindin' sky over the ocean was quite a sight to behold. I daren't let us rest though, as some mighty big beasties roam these shores. That's when I saw the first of 'em. A livin' mass-o-blades. But they was nothin' like I thought they'd be. Gentle to the touch  so long as you ain't touchin' the wrong spot! One took a likin' to me and, after I gave her a bit of bread, followed me for three days! Heh, never thought I'd befriend a dinosaur so easily.

trait.name: Razor Osteoderms
entries: Any creature that hits Scelidosaurus with a melee attack suffers {@damage 1d6} slashing damage. Scelidosaurus may use its reaction to increase this to {@damage 2d4} slashing damage.
Scelidosaurus is resistant to non-magical bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage (included above).

trait.name: Oblivious
entries: Scelidosaurus automatically fails any Intelligence saving throws.

trait.name: Domesticatable
entries: Scelidosaurus is particularly trustful of Small or Medium-sized creatures, largely due to its formidable defences. It is relatively easy to domesticate, and players can befriend a Scelidosaurus by feeding it consistently for a {@dice 1d4 + 1} days. However, their Razor Osteoderms prevent Scelidosaurus from being ridden without a bespoke saddle. Nevertheless, they make for friendly travelling companions.

action.name: Serrated Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

We'd been travellin' through that accursed forest for days, barely able to see the sky through the thick canopy. One took a likin' to me and, after I gave her a bit of bread, followed me for three days! Heh, never thought I'd befriend a dinosaur so easily.

trait.name: Pelvic Membrane
entries: Sharovipteryx is immune to falling damage and can move up to 2 ft. horizontally for every 1 ft. it descends in the air, at no movement cost.
While descending in the air in this manner (or while flying if you are using the optional magical rules), Sharovipteryx does not provoke attacks of opportunity when it moves out of an enemy's reach.

action.name: Gliding Snap
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}1 (1) piercing damage.
Sharovipteryx may only use this attack while descending in the air (or while flying if you are using the optional magical rules).

The jungle was bustlin' with life. Lizards, pterosaurs, and small dinosaurs filled the canopy above. As we walked below, I spied one particularly unusual critter soarin' between branches. It was a lil' lizard-like thing that was gliding usin' only its hind legs! Never seen anythin' like that before, how bizarre. We tried to get a closer look, but it was quite skittish and leapt from the tree whenever we went to climb up.

trait.name: Pelvic Membrane
entries: Sharovipteryx is immune to falling damage and can move up to 2 ft. horizontally for every 1 ft. it descends in the air, at no movement cost.
While descending in the air in this manner (or while flying if you are using the optional magical rules), Sharovipteryx does not provoke attacks of opportunity when it moves out of an enemy's reach.

trait.name: Familiar
entries: Sharovipteryx may be used as a familiar via the {@spell Find Familiar} spell or any similar effect.

trait.name: Podopteryx (1/day)
entries: As an action, Sharovipteryx can take on the appearance of its original namesake, the Damselfly Podopteryx, for one minute. During this time, it gains a 40 ft. fly speed, its size becomes Miniscule, and its AC becomes 17.

action.name: Gliding Snap
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}1 (1) piercing damage.
Sharovipteryx may only use this attack while descending in the air (or while flying if you are using the optional magical rules).

It was a lil' lizard-like thing that was gliding usin' only its hind legs! Never seen anythin' like that before, how bizarre. We tried to get a closer look, but it was quite skittish and leapt from the tree whenever we went to climb up.

trait.name: Dip Feeder
entries: Tanystropheus has advantage on attacks against creatures that are submerged in water, so long as Tanystropheus' body is not also submerged in water. Tanystropheus can hold its breath for 5 minutes.

trait.name: Farstrike
entries: Tanystropheus often attacks from a concealed position, hiding its body while reaching out with its long neck to strike prey.
If Tanystropheus attacks while hidden, its first attack deals an additional {@damage 1d6} piercing damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: If Tanystropheus chooses the attack action, it may make one Neck Strike attack and one Nip attack.

action.name: Neck Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) bludgeoning damage.
A Medium or Small creature hit by this attack must succeed a {@dc 12} Strength or Dexterity saving throw (their choice) or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Nip
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) piercing damage.

We were followin' a small river upstream, searchin' for a good place to camp for the evenin'. Out of nowhere, a long neck and lil' head whipped out of the reeds and nipped one of our party members on the leg. At first, we thought it was a snake, but then it reared up several feet into the air and burst from the reeds, scurryin' into the water. As it dived, we saw the rest of its body. It was a weird lookin' beastie, with a neck twice as long as its body!

If Tanystropheus attacks while hidden, its first attack deals an additional {@damage 1d6} piercing damage.

trait.name: Basal Hydra
entries: Increase Tanystropheus' Hit Points to 58. Each time Tanystropheus takes damage, it grows an additional head up to a maximum of six. When Tanystropheus uses Multiattack, it may make an additional Nip attack for each head beyond the first, up to a maximum of six Nip attacks.
Tanystropheus starts with two heads.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: If Tanystropheus chooses the attack action, it may make one Neck Strike attack and one Nip attack (plus additional Nip attacks from Basal Hydra).

action.name: Neck Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) bludgeoning damage.
A Medium or Small creature hit by this attack must succeed a {@dc 12} Strength or Dexterity saving throw (their choice) or be knocked {@condition prone}.

entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) piercing damage.

Out of nowhere, a long neck and lil' head whipped out of the reeds and nipped one of our party members on the leg. At first, we thought it was a snake, but then it reared up several feet into the air and burst from the reeds, scurryin' into the water. As it dived, we saw the rest of its body. It was a weird lookin' beastie, with a neck twice as long as its body!

trait.name: Leaping Ambush
entries: If Utahraptor was hidden at the start of its turn, its Razor-Clawed Kick gains the following benefits this turn:
An additional +3 to hit.
An additional {@damage 1d8 + 3} slashing damage (as the weight of Utahraptor rends its claws down the target's body).
Any Medium or smaller creature hit by it is knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Athletic and Pneumatized
entries: Utahraptor can jump up to 30 ft. from standing and it takes half damage from falling.

trait.name: Grappling Predator
entries: If a creature smaller than Utahraptor is hit by Utahraptor's Razor-Clawed Kick, that creature is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 17}).
If a creature the same size category as, or larger than, Utahraptor is hit by two Razor-Clawed Kick attacks in the same turn, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 20}).

trait.name: Social Hunter
entries: If more than one Utahraptor is tracking a creature together, they all have advantage on Survival and Perception checks to track that creature.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: If Utahraptor chooses the attack action, it may make one Vicious Bite attack and one Razor-Clawed Kick attack.

action.name: Vicious Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Razor-Clawed Kick
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

Unlike their smaller cousins, these ones are truly somethin' to be feared. Boundin' out of the brush in a flurry of teeth, claws, and feathers, they'll rip all but the hardiest foes to shreds in a matter of moments. No qualms about takin' on something much bigger than themselves either. We spied five workin' their way through a clearin', takin' out a large hadrosaur in one go. Thankfully, we were way up a steep cliff, otherwise we might've been puddin'.

trait.name: Leaping Ambush
entries: If Utahraptor was hidden at the start of its turn, its Razor-Clawed Kick gains the following benefits this turn:
An additional +3 to hit.
An additional {@damage 1d8 + 3} slashing damage (as the weight of Utahraptor rends its claws down the target's body).
Any Medium or smaller creature hit by it is knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Social Hunter
entries: If more than one Utahraptor is tracking a creature together, they all have advantage on Survival and Perception checks to track that creature.

trait.name: Mimicking Cry
entries: Utahraptor can imitate the sound of any creature or noise it has heard with accuracy, much like a parrot. It tends to use this ability while hiding to lure prey closer to it.
If a creature uses its action to examine the sound, it can determine that it is a mimicked effect with a successful {@dc 14} Investigation check.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: If Utahraptor chooses the attack action, it may make one Vicious Bite attack and one Razor-Clawed Kick attack.

action.name: Vicious Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Razor-Clawed Kick
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Feathered and Pneumatized
entries: Velociraptor can leap up to 15 ft. from standing. It takes no damage from falling, unless {@condition incapacitated} in which case it takes half damage instead.

trait.name: Grasping Predator
entries: If Velociraptor hits a creature the same size or larger than itself with its Clawed Kick, it can opt to grasp onto it. Whenever that creature moves, Velociraptor moves with it (without using any of its own movement) and is considered to be occupying the same space as it. A Small creature is {@condition grappled} while Velociraptor is grasping onto it.

As an action, the hit creature may make a {@dc 12} Strength saving throw to remove Velociraptor, ending this effect and pushing Velociraptor 5 ft. directly away from it on a success. Alternatively, Velociraptor may choose to end this effect at any time.
If two or more Velociraptor are grasping the same Medium or Large creature with this ability, halve its movement speed.

trait.name: Silent Ambush
entries: Velociraptor can move without making a sound. It automatically passes any Stealth check to avoid being detected by sound while hidden. Other creature's Perception checks that would detect Velociraptor only by sound automatically fail.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: If Velociraptor chooses the attack action, it may make one Sharp Bite attack and one Clawed Kick attack.

action.name: Sharp Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Clawed Kick
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage.

These quick lil' things really lived up to their name. Vicious as anything  two of 'em jumped me while I was takin' a wizz. Lightnin' fast attack. Thankfully, as soon as the rest of the party came runnin' to me cries for help, they scattered. Not interested in takin' on lots of prey at once it seems. The party found me all scratched up in a heap though. What an embarrassin' encounter.

trait.name: Feathered and Pneumatized
entries: Velociraptor can leap up to 15 ft. from standing. It takes no damage from falling, unless {@condition incapacitated} in which case it takes half damage instead.

trait.name: Grasping Predator
entries: If Velociraptor hits a creature the same size or larger than itself with its Clawed Kick, it can opt to grasp onto it. Whenever that creature moves, Velociraptor moves with it (without using any of its own movement) and is considered to be occupying the same space as it. A Small creature is {@condition grappled} while Velociraptor is grasping onto it.

As an action, the hit creature may make a {@dc 12} Strength saving throw to remove Velociraptor, ending this effect and pushing Velociraptor 5 ft. directly away from it on a success. Alternatively, Velociraptor may choose to end this effect at any time.
If two or more Velociraptor are grasping the same Medium or Large creature with this ability, halve its movement speed.

trait.name: Silent Ambush
entries: Velociraptor can move without making a sound. It automatically passes any Stealth check to avoid being detected by sound while hidden. Other creature's Perception checks that would detect Velociraptor only by sound automatically fail.

trait.name: Vivid Familial Groups
entries: Each time the party encounter Velociraptor, it may be present in groups of 3-6 animals, representing a family group. Some of these animals may be hidden nearby. This group consists of an adult male, adult female, and 1-4 subadult animals.
These animals all share a similar dazzling under-plumage that is hidden by overlying feathers (it does not hinder their ability to be stealthy) and is unique to their group.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: If Velociraptor chooses the attack action, it may make one Sharp Bite attack and one Clawed Kick attack.

action.name: Sharp Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Clawed Kick
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Dazzling Reveal
entries: As an action, Velociraptor may unleash a dazzling array of magical display feathers. One enemy creature within 30 ft. of Velociraptor must succeed a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 2d6} damage of a damage type that corresponds to their plumage colour, or psychic damage (DM's choice).

These quick lil' things really lived up to their name. Vicious as anything  two of 'em jumped me while I was takin' a wizz. Lightnin' fast attack. Thankfully, as soon as the rest of the party came runnin' to me cries for help, they scattered. Not interested in takin' on lots of prey at once it seems. The party found me all scratched up in a heap though. What an embarrassin' encounter.

trait.name: Burst of Speed
entries: Young Tyrannosaurus can dash as a bonus action.

trait.name: Naive
entries: Young Tyrannosaurus has a -3 modifier to Wisdom saving throws (included above).

trait.name: Tailswipe
entries: As a bonus action, Young Tyrannosaurus may swipe at a single creature within 5 ft. with its tail. That creature must succeed a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw or take 17 ({@damage 3d6 + 7}) bludgeoning damage. Young Tyrannosaurus cannot target a creature with this ability that it is currently grappling.

action.name: Snapping Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}23 ({@damage 4d8 + 5}) piercing damage.
A Medium or smaller creature hit by this attack is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 14}). Young Tyrannosaurus cannot Snapping Bite another target while grappling a creature.

We pushed through thick undergrowth that reeked of rotting meat, the sickly smell fillin' me nostrils. The half-devoured carcasses of various herbivores lit'ered the area, decayin' slowly. "This is rex territory" I whispered to the rest of the party. "But tis OK, we'll hear 'em comin' long befo-". My words were split by the sudden crash of bushes and trees bein' crushed beneath the thunderin' charge of a dinosaur. Far smaller than expected, but also far faster, a young Tyrannosaurus rex was barin' down on us somethin' fierce.

trait.name: Burst of Speed
entries: Young Tyrannosaurus can dash as a bonus action.

trait.name: Naive
entries: Young Tyrannosaurus has a -3 modifier to Wisdom saving throws (included above).

trait.name: Tailswipe

That creature must succeed a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw or take 17 ({@damage 3d6 + 7}) bludgeoning damage. Young Tyrannosaurus cannot target a creature with this ability that it is currently grappling.

trait.name: Cliff Scene
entries: When Young Tyrannosaurus is reduced to 0 hit points, it lets out a shrill cry. A few moments later, the roar of two adult Tyrannosaurus rex can be heard in the distance. After one minute, two Tyrannosaurus Rex (Basic Rules, pg. 157) appear and attack the party, focusing initially on whoever reduced the Young Tyrannosaurus to 0 hit points. If another adult Tyrannosaurus is already present, this effect does not occur.

action.name: Snapping Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}23 ({@damage 4d8 + 5}) piercing damage.
A Medium or smaller creature hit by this attack is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 14}). Young Tyrannosaurus cannot Snapping Bite another target while grappling a creature.

We pushed through thick undergrowth that reeked of rotting meat, the sickly smell fillin' me nostrils. The half-devoured carcasses of various herbivores lit'ered the area, decayin' slowly. "This is rex territory" I whispered to the rest of the party. "But tis OK, we'll hear 'em comin' long befo-". My words were split by the sudden crash of bushes and trees bein' crushed beneath the thunderin' charge of a dinosaur. Far smaller than expected, but also far faster, a young Tyrannosaurus rex was barin' down on us somethin' fierce.

trait.name: Ankylosaur Osteoderms
entries: Zuul is resistant to non-magical bludgeoning, slashing, and piercing damage, has an AC of 20, a -10 modifier to Acrobatics, and a -8 modifier to Athletics (excluding for shove and grapple checks, all included above).

trait.name: Hulking Mass
entries: Zuul has disadvantage on all Dexterity saving throws, but advantage on all Constitution and Strength saving throws.

action.name: Clubbed Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 2d12 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

A creature hit by this attack must succeed a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. Any creature knocked {@condition prone} by this attack (or was already {@condition prone}) must then succeed a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or suffer a "shattering blow" and have their movement speed reduced by 10 ft.

A {@spell lesser restoration} spell, equivalent effect, or long rest is required to remove "shattering blow". Multiple "shattering blows" are cumulative, reducing a creature's movement speed by 10 ft. for each blow (to a minimum of 5 ft.).

As we moved over the rollin' scrub, we came across somethin' remarkable. A lone dinosaur feeding on scrub, entirely oblivious to us. Few times in my life had I ever come across such an unyieldin' amount of muscle and armour. When I first saw this thing, I knew it was built for one thing and one thing only  defence. We studied it in detail. Armoured back, armoured limbs, even armoured eyelids. Unbelievable. It didn't even seem to mind us flittin' around it.

trait.name: Ankylosaur Osteoderms
entries: Zuul is resistant to non-magical bludgeoning, slashing, and piercing damage, has an AC of 20, a -10 modifier to Acrobatics, and a -8 modifier to Athletics (excluding for shove and grapple checks, all included above).

trait.name: Hulking Mass
entries: Zuul has disadvantage on all Dexterity saving throws, but advantage on all Constitution and Strength saving throws.

trait.name: Ectoplasmic Reach
entries: A ghoulish jelly like substance extends from Zuul's tail. Increase the reach of Zuul's Clubbed Tail attack to 15 ft. and change its damage type to necrotic.

action.name: Clubbed Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 2d12 + 6}) necrotic damage.

A creature hit by this attack must succeed a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. Any creature knocked {@condition prone} by this attack (or was already {@condition prone}) must then succeed a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or suffer a "shattering blow" and have their movement speed reduced by 10 ft.

A {@spell lesser restoration} spell, equivalent effect, or long rest is required to remove "shattering blow". Multiple "shattering blows" are cumulative, reducing a creature's movement speed by 10 ft. for each blow (to a minimum of 5 ft.).

action.name: The Gatekeeper (1/day)
entries: As an action, Zuul can attempt to open an interdimensional portal directly in front of it that ejects malicious energies. Roll a {@dice 1d20}:
On a 1, Zuul detonates with malicious magical energies, dealing {@damage 8d8} necrotic damage to itself and {@damage 4d8} necrotic damage to each other creature within 25 ft.

On a 2-10, an unstable portal forms for 1 minute and pulses with malicious energy. Each creature (other than Zuul) within 25 ft. of it must succeed a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 1d8} necrotic damage. As a bonus action, Zuul can pulse the portal, forcing this save again.

On an 11-19, a metastable portal forms for 1 minute and crackles with malicious energy. Each creature (other than Zuul) within 25 ft. of it must succeed a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 1d8} necrotic damage and gain vulnerability to necrotic damage for 1 minute. As a bonus action, Zuul can pulse the portal, forcing this save again.

On a 20, a stable portal opens for 1 minute. Each creature (other than Zuul) that starts its turn within or moves within 25 ft. of the portal gains vulnerability to necrotic damage. At the start of their turn, any creature (other than Zuul) within 25 ft. of the portal suffers {@damage 1d8} necrotic damage.
If Zuul is slain, the portal it created either closes or stabilises to another plane of existence (DM's decision) for {@dice 1d20} minutes.

As we moved over the rollin' scrub, we came across somethin' remarkable. A lone dinosaur feeding on scrub, entirely oblivious to us. Few times in my life had I ever come across such an unyieldin' amount of muscle and armour. When I first saw this thing, I knew it was built for one thing and one thing only  defence. We studied it in detail. Armoured back, armoured limbs, even armoured eyelids. Unbelievable. It didn't even seem to mind us flittin' around it.

trait.name: Power Over Speed
entries: Ancient Tyrannosaurus Rex has advantage on all Strength checks and Strength saving throws, but disadvantage on all Dexterity checks and Dexterity saving throws.

trait.name: Territorial Titan
entries: Ancient Tyrannosaurus Rex has advantage on attacks with its Strongest Bite against creatures with a size category of Huge or Gargantuan.

trait.name: When Dinosaurs Ruled the Earth
entries: All non-Tyrannosaurus beasts are {@condition frightened} of Ancient Tyrannosaurus Rex.

Every minute while within line of sight of Ancient Tyrannosaurus Rex, or at the end of each of its turns in combat, a beast can make a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw to become immune to this ability for 24 hours. Succeeding this Wisdom saving throw does not make it immune to Ancient Tyrannosaurus Rex's Iconic Bellow.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (2/day)
entries: If Ancient Tyrannosaurus Rex fails a saving throw, it may choose to succeed it instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: If Ancient Tyrannosaurus Rex chooses the attack action, it may make one Strongest Bite attack and one Crushing Tail Slam attack.

action.name: Strongest Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}23 ({@damage 3d12 + 4}) piercing damage plus 23 ({@damage 3d12 + 4}) force damage.

A creature hit by this attack is {@condition grappled} and {@condition restrained} (escape {@dc 21}). Until this grapple ends, Ancient Tyrannosaurus Rex can't Strongest Bite another target and has an additional +5 to hit the grappled creature with any Strongest Bite attack.

action.name: Crushing Tail Slam
entries: Each creature within 10 ft. of Ancient Tyrannosaurus Rex must succeed a {@dc 21} Dexterity saving throw or take 28 ({@damage 3d12 + 9}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. On a success they take half as much damage and are not knocked {@condition prone}.
A creature grappled by Strongest Bite is not affected by this attack.

action.name: Iconic Bellow
entries: Every non-Tyrannosaur creature within 200 ft. of Ancient Tyrannosaurus Rex that can hear it must succeed a {@dc 20} Wisdom saving throw or take 13 ({@damage 1d12 + 7}) psychic damage and be {@condition frightened} of Ancient Tyrannosaurus Rex for 1 minute. A creature can repeat this saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful, the creature is immune to the {@condition frightened} condition from Ancient Tyrannosaurus Rex's Iconic Bellow for the next 24 hours.

legendary.name: Lunging Head Bash
entries: Ancient Tyrannosaurus Rex may move up to 10 ft., then make the following attack:
{@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 2d10 + 9}) bludgeoning damage.

For a week we had been restin' at a small settlement in the Southeast of the continent, eager to explore further South. Our gracious hosts warned us not to go traipsin' through the southern forests, as it was guarded by a fearsome beast. They just kept callin' it the "Blue Death" and told hyperbolic stories of a maw so great that'd swallow a full party whole and limbs so powerful that they couldn't be stopped.

monster.name: Ancient Tyrannosaurus Rex (Magical Variant)
languages: Archosauric
understands one other language (usually Common)

trait.name: Imparted Speech
entries: Ancient Tyrannosaurus Rex can understand Archosauric and another language of your choosing (usually Common). It can speak Archosauric, albeit slowly. Its Intelligence score is increased to 8.

trait.name: Wise Old Beast
entries: Ancient Tyrannosaurus Rex has advantage on Wisdom saving throws.

Our gracious hosts warned us not to go traipsin' through the southern forests, as it was guarded by a fearsome beast. They just kept callin' it the "Blue Death" and told hyperbolic stories of a maw so great that'd swallow a full party whole and limbs so powerful that they couldn't be stopped.

trait.name: Steady Healing
entries: At the end of Big Al's turn, she recovers 8 hit points. Big Al is resistant to necrotic damage (included above).

trait.name: Clumsy
entries: Whenever Big Al begins moving, roll a {@dice 1d20}. On the roll of a 1, Big Al instead stumbles and trips directly forward 10 ft., is knocked {@condition prone}, suffers {@damage 1d4} bludgeoning damage, and cannot move for the rest of her turn.
If Big Al is below 10 hit points, she stumbles on a roll of 1-10, rather than just 1.

trait.name: Subadult
entries: Big Al's Wisdom stat is reduced to 6 (included above) and she cannot gain advantage on any Wisdom checks or Wisdom saving throws.

trait.name: Stalker
entries: The first time each day that Big Al fails a Stealth check, she may instead choose to succeed it.

trait.name: Starving
entries: The first time an Animal Handling check is made against Big Al each day, if that check utilises food suitable for a carnivore, it automatically succeeds.
If Big Al is fed, she'll periodically return to whoever fed her of her own accord for more food.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: If Big Al chooses the attack action, she may make one Big Al's Maw attack and one Big Al's Claws attack.

action.name: Big Al's Maw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d8 + 6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Big Al's Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) slashing damage.

More than once we came across a young injured Allosaurus. The rest of the party kept callin' it "Big Al". No idea why the name stuck, but it did. It seemed to walk with a wobbly gait, like it had hurt its toe, but still pushed on. Poor thin' never had the stomach to really attack us it kinda just followed our group for a while, fed on scraps, left, then returned every now 'n' again. I imagine it would have given it a go if our group had been fewer in number though.

trait.name: Steady Healing
entries: At the end of Big Al's turn, she recovers 8 hit points. Big Al is resistant to necrotic damage (included above).

trait.name: Clumsy
entries: Whenever Big Al begins moving, roll a {@dice 1d20}. On the roll of a 1, Big Al instead stumbles and trips directly forward 10 ft., is knocked {@condition prone}, suffers {@damage 1d4} bludgeoning damage, and cannot move for the rest of her turn.
If Big Al is below 10 hit points, she stumbles on a roll of 1-10, rather than just 1.

entries: The first time an Animal Handling check is made against Big Al each day, if that check utilises food suitable for a carnivore, it automatically succeeds.
If Big Al is fed, she'll periodically return to whoever fed her of her own accord for more food.

trait.name: Big Al's Ballad
entries: When Big Al awakens at dawn each day or is in combat, dramatic orchestral music plays loudly centred over her location and all of Big Al's choices, thoughts, and actions are also narrated by a disembodied, stoic British voice. This music and voice can only be heard by player characters.

trait.name: Story Set in Stone
entries: Big Al cannot be killed by normal means. If Big Al is reduced to 0 hit points or suffers an effect that would kill her, she instead falls to 1 hit point, cannot attack, loses her Steady Healing ability, and will flee from combat.

She can only take lethal damage from her Clumsy ability. If she does not trip while fleeing, she will wander for 24 hours, then die emaciated on the nearest riverbank. However, if Big Al is healed during this 24 hour period (excluding from a short/long rest), she regains her Steady Healing ability, is able to attack again, and may behave normally.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: If Big Al chooses the attack action, she may make one Big Al's Maw attack and one Big Al's Claws attack.

action.name: Big Al's Maw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d8 + 6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Big Al's Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) slashing damage.

It seemed to walk with a wobbly gait, like it had hurt its toe, but still pushed on. Poor thin' never had the stomach to really attack us it kinda just followed our group for a while, fed on scraps, left, then returned every now 'n' again. I imagine it would have given it a go if our group had been fewer in number though.

trait.name: Olfactory Enlargement
entries: Carnotaurus has a +10 bonus to any Perception check that involves smell. If its sense of smell is hindered or lost, it instead has a -10 modifier and disadvantage on any Perception check that involves smell.

trait.name: Explosive Ambush!
entries: In the first round of combat, Carnotaurus may dash as a bonus action.

trait.name: Scent of Prey
entries: Carnotaurus has advantage on Survival checks to pursue prey.

trait.name: Possible Pack Mentality
entries: All Carnotaurus treat other Carnotaurus as allies.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: If Carnotaurus chooses the attack action, it may make two Slashing Bite attacks and one Brow Horn Gore attack.

action.name: Slashing Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage plus 5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Brow Horn Gore
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d10 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.
A creature hit by this attack must make a {@dc 11} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

Some predatory dinosaurs hunt largely by smell and carno was one such beastie. It pursued us for four days, followin' the scent trail we left. Thankfully, we were able to out manoeuvre it. More than once we crossed a river, and circled round to observe it. We watched it lose, then re-pick up our trail several times. Must have been very hungry to chase us for so long. I guess it picked up the trail of somethin' easier to track when it stopped followin' us though.

trait.name: Olfactory Enlargement
entries: Carnotaurus has a +10 bonus to any Perception check that involves smell. If its sense of smell is hindered or lost, it instead has a -10 modifier and disadvantage on any Perception check that involves smell.

trait.name: Explosive Ambush!
entries: In the first round of combat, Carnotaurus may dash as a bonus action.

trait.name: Scent of Prey
entries: Carnotaurus has advantage on Survival checks to pursue prey.

trait.name: Possible Pack Mentality
entries: All Carnotaurus treat other Carnotaurus as allies.

trait.name: Venerated Headwear
entries: Local people venerate the Carnotaurus and worship them by adorning them with a variety of headdresses as they sleep. This is seen as a right-of-passage or coming-of-age ceremony by some cultures and is a test of an individual's stealth and sleight of hand. With Carnotaurus' short arms unable to reach its head, headwear may stay on one for several weeks or months. This headwear is often crafted from expensive silks or inlaid with precious gemstones and can be highly valuable (we recommend a value of {@dice 2d100 + 50} gp). This leads to Carnotaurus sometimes being targeted by bandits for raids which, more often than not, results in an easy meal for the Carnotaurus.
Stolen headdresses are seen as contraband by their respective cultures.

trait.name: A Familiar Smell
entries: Carnotaurus becomes accustomed to the smell of its Venerated Headwear and will instinctively follow its scent if stolen. A player or NPC harbouring stolen Venerated Headwear will be hunted by its respective Carnotaurus. That Carnotaurus automatically passes any Perception check to detect its Venerated Headwear that involves smell.

If that Carnotaurus is alive and not {@condition incapacitated}, roll a {@dice 1d6} whenever the harbouring player/NPC takes a long rest. On a 5 or 6, the Carnotaurus interrupts and attacks them during that long rest.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: If Carnotaurus chooses the attack action, it may make two Slashing Bite attacks and one Brow Horn Gore attack.

action.name: Slashing Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage plus 5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Brow Horn Gore
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d10 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.
A creature hit by this attack must make a {@dc 11} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.
