More than once we crossed a river, and circled round to observe it. We watched it lose, then re-pick up our trail several times. Must have been very hungry to chase us for so long. I guess it picked up the trail of somethin' easier to track when it stopped followin' us though.

trait.name: Grasping Forelimbs
entries: Dilophosaurus can grapple as a bonus action. However, while grappling a creature, Dilophosaurus cannot use its Dextrous Claws attack.

trait.name: Dual Skull Crests
entries: As a bonus action, Dilophosaurus may flush its crests with blood, giving them a bold red colour. If it does so, it has advantage on Intimidation checks for 1 minute.

trait.name: Apparent Fragility
entries: Dilophosaurus appears to be a fragile animal, but it is in fact much hardier than it looks. The first time Dilophosaurus is reduced to 0 hit points, it is reduced to 1 hit point instead. Once this feature has been used it cannot be used again until the next dawn.

trait.name: Agile Hunter
entries: Dilophosaurus has advantage on Dexterity saving throws.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: If Dilophosaurus chooses the attack action, it may make one Recurved Bite attack and one Dextrous Claws attack. Alternatively, it may make a single Neck Sweep attack.

action.name: Recurved Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) piercing damage.
A Medium or smaller creature hit by this attack must succeed a {@dc 12} Strength saving throw or drop an item they are wielding.

action.name: Dextrous Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d4 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Neck Sweep
entries: Each creature within a 10 ft. cone in front of Dilophosaurus must make a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw or take 6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. On a success they take half as much damage and are not knocked {@condition prone}.

We had been hackin' our way through the dense, hot swamp for several hours now. Everythin' we had encountered had been small enough to just spook away, but that was about to change. A horrible hissin' sound creeped out of the heavy foliage to me left, then a dual-crested gnarl-toothed head poked out at eye-level to me. I fell back, gaspin' in shock as the head began to rise. As it did, a large gangly theropod stepped out, towerin' over me.

trait.name: Grasping Forelimbs
entries: Dilophosaurus can grapple as a bonus action. However, while grappling a creature, Dilophosaurus cannot use its Dextrous Claws attack.

trait.name: Dual Skull Crests
entries: As a bonus action, Dilophosaurus may flush its crests with blood, giving them a bold red colour. If it does so, it has advantage on Intimidation checks for 1 minute.

trait.name: Apparent Fragility
entries: Dilophosaurus appears to be a fragile animal, but it is in fact much hardier than it looks. The first time Dilophosaurus is reduced to 0 hit points, it is reduced to 1 hit point instead. Once this feature has been used it cannot be used again until the next dawn.

trait.name: Agile Hunter
entries: Dilophosaurus has advantage on Dexterity saving throws.

trait.name: Anthesis to Spitting
entries: Dilophosaurus could never spit venom and it despises all suggestions that it should. This has given it an innate magical aura that protects it from similar attacks. All ranged attacks against Dilophosaurus are made at disadvantage. Additionally, Dilophosaurus is immune to poison and acid damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: If Dilophosaurus chooses the attack action, it may make one Recurved Bite attack and one Dextrous Claws attack. Alternatively, it may make a single Neck Sweep attack.

action.name: Recurved Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) piercing damage.
A Medium or smaller creature hit by this attack must succeed a {@dc 12} Strength saving throw or drop an item they are wielding.

action.name: Dextrous Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d4 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Neck Sweep
entries: Each creature within a 10 ft. cone in front of Dilophosaurus must make a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw or take 6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. On a success they take half as much damage and are not knocked {@condition prone}.

We had been hackin' our way through the dense, hot swamp for several hours now. Everythin' we had encountered had been small enough to just spook away, but that was about to change. A horrible hissin' sound creeped out of the heavy foliage to me left, then a dual-crested gnarl-toothed head poked out at eye-level to me. I fell back, gaspin' in shock as the head began to rise. As it did, a large gangly theropod stepped out, towerin' over me.

trait.name: Subsurface Monster
entries: Wretchglow, the Last Light can hold its breath for up to 10 hours and has advantage on Stealth checks while submerged in water.
If Wretchglow, the Last Light is hidden, as a bonus action it can create an illusionary lure, following the same rules as its Bioluminescent Lure legendary action.

trait.name: Bioluminescence
entries: Wretchglow, the Last Light can opt to emit a dull glow of any colour, creating dim light for 40 ft. around it. It can activate/deactivate this light at will at any point but, while active, it cannot hide.

trait.name: Oscillating Thermoregulation
entries: Wretchglow, the Last Light has resistance to fire and cold damage (included above).

trait.name: Intelligent
entries: Wretchglow, the Last Light is capable of planning in combat and is able to utilise its environment to help defeat foes (i.e., drowning foes or causing cave collapses).

trait.name: Rostral Dermal Pressure Sensors
entries: While in water, Wretchglow, the Last Light has a blindsight of 10 ft. (included above).

action.name: Bioluminescent Flash {@recharge 5}
entries: As an action, Wretchglow, the Last Light can unleash a huge flash of light. Each other creature within 40 ft. that can see it must succeed a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw or be {@condition blinded} for two rounds.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: If Wretchglow, the Last Light chooses the attack action, it can make one Colossal Needle-Toothed Jaws attack and one Hooked Claw attack.

action.name: Colossal Needle-Toothed Jaws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}32 ({@damage 6d6 + 11}) piercing damage.

A creature hit by this attack is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 19}). While a creature is grappled by this attack, Wretchglow, the Last Light cannot attack another target with its Colossal Needle-Toothed Jaws attack.

action.name: Hooked Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}24 ({@damage 3d8 + 11}) slashing damage.
A creature hit by this attack can be moved up to 5 ft. in any direction by Wretchglow, the Last Light (no save allowed).

legendary.name: Misdirecting Strobe
entries: Each creature within 40 ft. of Wretchglow, the Last Light that can see it must succeed a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw or have disadvantage on attack rolls until the end of their next turn. If they roll a natural 1 on the Dexterity saving throw, they are instead {@condition stunned} until the end of their next turn.

legendary.name: Direct Currents
entries: So long as Wretchglow, the Last Light is submerged in water, it may pick up to 4 creatures within 60 ft. who are also submerged in connected water and move them up to 10 ft. in any direction, so long as they remain submerged in water.

legendary.name: Bioluminescent Lure
entries: Wretchglow, the Last Light creates a visual illusion up to 10 ft. in size that must be within 30 ft. of itself. The illusion ends if Wretchglow, the Last Light moves more than 30 ft. away from it, if it uses this legendary action again, or if it chooses to dismiss the illusion. Any other creature that sees the illusion must succeed a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw, or perceive the illusion as real (and generally be drawn to it).
On its turn, a creature can determine that it is an illusion with a successful {@dc 16} Investigation check.

I've done me fair share of minin' while studyin' subterranean geology. When our rogue suggested some spelunkin' to explore further into the cave systems that the locals lived in, I thought it'd be a nice break from the dangers of the forest we'd been trekkin' through for the last month  a bit of peace 'n' quiet and no giant dinos tryin' to eat us. How wrong I was

trait.name: Reactionary Crystalline Regulation
entries: Xu'thul, the Prismatic Terror may use its reaction to gain immunity to fire, cold, lightning, thunder, acid, poison, radiant, necrotic, psychic, or force damage until its next turn. The crystals on its body visibly flicker/crackle/bubble with energies of the associated damage type.
This immunity is in addition to any gained by its Elemental Absorb legendary action.

trait.name: Surging Power
entries: At the start of Xu'thul, the Prismatic Terror's turn, select one of the following effects:
1. It may make an additional Hooked Claw attack this turn.
2. It may dash as a bonus action this turn.
3. Each creature within 10 ft. of it must succeed a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 2d10} lightning damage.
4. It has advantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Semi-Aquatic
entries: Xu'thul, the Prismatic Terror can hold its breath for up to 30 minutes.

trait.name: Rostral Dermal Pressure Sensors
entries: While in water (or lava), Xu'thul, the Prismatic Terror has a blindsight of 10 ft. (included above).

trait.name: Crystalline Form
entries: Xu'thul, the Prismatic Terror is immune to any effect that would {@condition charmed||charm} or {@condition petrified||petrify} it (included above).

action.name: Unleash Energies {@recharge 5}
entries: Crackling magical energies erupt from Xu'thul, the Prismatic Terror. Each other creature within 40 ft. must succeed a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 6d10} lightning damage and {@damage 6d6} force damage. On a success they take half as much damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: If Xu'thul, the Prismatic Terror chooses the attack action, it may make one Shardmaw Bite attack and one Hooked Claw attack.

action.name: Shardmaw Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 3d6 + 12}) piercing damage plus 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage.

action.name: Hooked Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}25 ({@damage 3d8 + 12}) slashing damage.
A creature hit by this attack can be moved up to 5 ft. in any direction by Xu'thul, the Prismatic Terror (no save allowed).

legendary.name: Shard Breath {@recharge 3}
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 10 ft. cone, up to four targets. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d10 + 5}) slashing damage.

legendary.name: Elemental Absorb
entries: Until its next turn, Xu'thul, the Prismatic Terror gains immunity to one damage type from the list below, however if it has already gained an immunity from this ability, it instead replaces it. Its crystals change colour to the associated colour.
1. Fire (red)
2. Cold (blue)
3. Lightning (yellow)
4. Poison (green)
This immunity is in addition to any gained from its Reactionary Crystalline Regulation ability.

legendary.name: Prismatic Glow
entries: Xu'thul, the Prismatic Terror produces a bright light, illuminating an area of up to 60 ft. with bright white light and a further 60 ft. with dim light (total 120 ft.). Each other creature within 10 ft. of it takes {@damage 1d10} radiant damage (no save allowed).
If Xu'thul, the Prismatic Terror has used Elemental Absorb this turn, the light is that associated colour instead.

It was well-known that throughout the highlands were a series of massive tarns, huge lake-like pools of water formed in the rugged glacially excavated expanse of the region's upper ranges. Flanked on all sides by sheer mountain cliffs, these formed lil' pockets of life among the otherwise sparsely vegetated rocky faces. In the western-most expanse, we came across a particularly large tarn that was surrounded by huge iridescent crystals.

monster.name: Pluvenn Flowertender
languages: any one language (usually Common or Archosauric)

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Pluvenn Flowertender's spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 12}, {@hit 4} to hit with spell attacks). It may cast the following spells:

trait.name: Rose Picker
entries: Pluvenn Flowertender has resistance to non-magical piercing damage (included above).

trait.name: Pinning Grapple
entries: Pluvenn Flowertender has an additional +3 bonus to Strength checks when attempting to grapple a creature. If a creature is {@condition grappled} by Pluvenn Flowertender, it takes {@damage 1d4} piercing damage.

trait.name: Nocturnal/Diurnal
entries: Pluvenn Flowertender only requires 4 hours of sleep per day.

action.name: Weed-Pulling Razormaw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1d6 + 1} piercing damage.

monster.name: Pluvenn Villager
languages: any one language (usually Common or Archosauric)

trait.name: Pinning Grapple
entries: Pluvenn Villager has an additional +3 bonus to Strength checks when attempting to grapple a creature. If a creature is {@condition grappled} by Pluvenn Villager, it takes {@damage 1d4 - 1} piercing damage (minimum of 1).

trait.name: Nocturnal/Diurnal
entries: Pluvenn Villager only requires 4 hours of sleep per day.

trait.name: Community Member
entries: Select one skill from the list below, this Pluvenn Villager gains a +3 bonus to any checks for that skill. Alternatively, you can select any tool (excluding Forgery Kit, Poisoner's Kit, and Thieves' Tools) and this Pluvenn Villager instead gains proficiency with that tool and an additional +2 bonus to any checks with it.

items: Animal Handling
History
Medicine
Nature
Performance
Persuasion
Religion

entries: This Pluvenn Villager should be appropriately dressed to match their community contribution/role.

action.name: Razormaw Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1d4 + 1} piercing damage.

monster.name: Pluvenn Huntleader
languages: any three languages (usually Common, Archosauric, and one other)

trait.name: Pinning Grapple
entries: Pluvenn Huntleader has an additional +3 bonus to Strength checks when attempting to grapple a creature. If a creature is {@condition grappled} by Pluvenn Huntleader, it takes {@damage 1d4 + 3} piercing damage.

trait.name: Master of the Hunt
entries: Pluvenn Huntleader only requires 4 hours of sleep per day, unless pursuing a marked target, in which case it only requires 2 hours of sleep per day. Pluvenn Huntleader also has advantage on Athletics checks for climbing.

trait.name: Endure Pain
entries: When hit by an attack, Pluvenn Huntleader can use its reaction to give itself resistance to either non-magical bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage until the start of its next turn.

action.name: Mark Target
entries: As a bonus action, Pluvenn Huntleader can apply a magical mark to a target that it can see within 60 ft. The mark is a blood-red, dully-glowing symbol. The mark can only be removed via magical means (i.e. {@spell dispel magic} or a similar effect), if the marked creature dies, or if Pluvenn Huntleader dies. Alternatively, Pluvenn Huntleader may dismiss the mark at will.

Pluvenn Huntleader has advantage on Survival checks to pursue a marked target and its attacks deal an additional {@damage 1d6} damage (of the same damage type) to the target. Only one mark per Pluvenn Huntleader may be active at a time.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: If Pluvenn Huntleader chooses the attack action, it may make any combination of three attacks with any of the weapons listed below.

action.name: Exquisite Longsword (+1)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1d8 + 6} magical slashing damage.

action.name: Wrist Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 9} to hit, range 60 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1d6 + 5} piercing damage.

action.name: Grappling Hook
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 9} to hit, range 40 ft., one target. {@h}2 piercing damage. A creature hit by this attack is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}). Only one creature may be grappled by this attack at a time. Pluvenn Huntleader does not gain the benefits of Pinning Grapple when grappling with this attack. Pluvenn Huntleader can only end the grapple from this attack as a bonus action.

monster.name: Manyhorn Guild Broker
languages: any three languages (usually Common, Archosauric, and one other)

trait.name: Flush Crest (2/Day)
entries: As a bonus action, Guild Broker can flush its head crest with blood, giving itself advantage on Charisma checks for the next 1 minute.

trait.name: Horned Repose
entries: If a creature fails to hit Guild Broker with a melee attack while within 5 ft. of it, Guild Broker may use its reaction to make a Horn Skewer attack back at that creature.

trait.name: Guild Knowledge
entries: Any party member known by a member of Guild Broker's guild for at least 24 hours is also known by Guild Broker. Additionally, Guild Broker knows any details that other members of its guild have learnt about them.

trait.name: Shrewd Negotiator
entries: Guild Broker has advantage on Persuasion checks and is immune to the {@condition charmed} condition (included above).

trait.name: Hip-Shooter
entries: An enemy being within 5 ft. of Guild Broker does not cause it to have disadvantage when making a ranged attack with its Concealed Hand Crossbow. Guild Broker's Concealed Hand Crossbow is hidden until fired.

action.name: Broke Peace
entries: As an action, Guild Broker can call for a truce. Each enemy that can hear Guild Broker and understands at least one of the languages that Guild Broker speaks must succeed a {@dc 11} Charisma saving throw or consider Guild Broker to no longer be an enemy and may not attack Guild Broker (or any member of Guild Broker's guild), unless it or one of its guild members attacks first or otherwise breaks the peace. A creature that is particularly hostile to Guild Broker makes its Charisma saving throw at advantage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: If Guild Broker chooses the attack action, it may make two Concealed Hand Crossbow attacks.

action.name: Concealed Hand Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 3} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1d6 + 1} piercing damage. If the first attack made by Guild Broker in combat is with this weapon, the attack is made at advantage and deals an additional {@damage 1d6} piercing damage.

action.name: Horn Skewer
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1d6 + 2} piercing damage.

monster.name: Manyhorn Guild Elder
languages: any three languages (usually Common, Archosauric, and one other)

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Manyhorn Guild Elder's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 14}, {@hit 6} to hit with spell attacks). It may cast the following spells:

trait.name: Flush Crest (3/Day)
entries: As a bonus action, Guild Elder can flush its head crest with blood, giving itself advantage on Charisma checks for the next 1 minute.

trait.name: Horned Repose
entries: If a creature fails to hit Guild Elder with a melee attack while within 5 ft. of it, Guild Elder may use its reaction to make a Horn Skewer attack back at that creature.

trait.name: Guild Knowledge
entries: Any party member known by a member of Guild Elder's guild for at least 24 hours is also known by Guild Elder. Additionally, Guild Elder knows any details that other members of its guild have learnt about them.

trait.name: Guild Master
entries: Any non-Guild Elder member of Guild Elder's guild will defend Guild Elder with their lives.

action.name: Guild Command
entries: As a bonus action, Guild Elder can command any other non-Guild Elder member of its guild who can hear it. That creature may immediately move up to its maximum walking speed and take an action.

action.name: Horn Skewer
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1d6 + 3} piercing damage.

action.name: Ceremonial Guild Sword (+1)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1d6 + 4} magical piercing damage.

monster.name: Manyhorn Guild Initiate
languages: any two languages (usually Common and Archosauric)

trait.name: Flush Crest (1/Day)
entries: As a bonus action, Guild Initiate can flush its head crest with blood, giving itself advantage on Charisma checks for the next 1 minute.

trait.name: Horned Repose
entries: If a creature fails to hit Guild Initiate with a melee attack while within 5 ft. of it, Guild Initiate may use its reaction to make a Horn Skewer attack back at that creature.

trait.name: Guild Knowledge
entries: Any party member known by a member of Guild Initiate's guild for at least 24 hours is also known by Guild Initiate. Additionally, Guild Initiate knows any details that other members of its guild have learnt about them.

action.name: Guild Mace
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1d6 + 2} bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Horn Skewer
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1d6 + 2} piercing damage.

monster.name: Jeholrak Defender
languages: any two languages (usually Common and Archosauric)

trait.name: Various Equipment
entries: Jeholrak Defender may be equipped with one of the three options below. They may only use the attack associated with each equipment set:

items: Sleek Short Sword and Shield (also increase AC by 2).
Two-handed Glaive.
Medium Crossbow.

trait.name: Calming Pheromones (1/Day)
entries: Jeholrak Defender may cast {@spell animal friendship} with a spell save DC of 11.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: If Jeholrak Defender chooses the attack action, it may make two attacks with whichever weapon it is equipped with.

action.name: Sleek Short Sword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1d6 + 3} piercing damage.

action.name: Two-handed Glaive
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1d10 + 3} slashing damage.

action.name: Medium Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 2} to hit, range 60/100 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1d8 + 1} piercing damage.

action.name: Conscript (1/Day)
entries: As an action, Jeholrak Defender may call a citizen to assist it. Choose another non-player character humanoid within 50 ft. of it that can see and hear Jeholrak Defender.

Jeholrak Defender makes a Persuasion check with a DC equal to the target humanoid's Charisma score. If that humanoid has a lawful alignment, then Jeholrak Defender makes this Persuasion check at advantage. If successful, the humanoid must assist Jeholrak Defender however they can for 1 minute, but will not harm an ally of theirs.

monster.name: Jeholrak Politician
languages: any four languages (usually Common, Archosauric, and two other languages)

trait.name: Demagogue
entries: In addition to other spells, once per day, the Jeholrak Politician may cast {@spell mass suggestion} (at 6th level, with a spell save DC of 13) without material components. Player characters are unaffected by this spell unless they are currently {@condition charmed} by Jeholrak Politician.

trait.name: Pheromonal Influence
entries: Jeholrak Politician may cast the following spells using Charisma as its spellcasting ability (with a spell save DC of 13).
2/day: {@spell charm person}, {@spell animal friendship}.
1/day: {@spell suggestion} (also see Demagogue).
Jeholrak Politician may cast these spells without components. The only indication that anything is happening is a slightly sweet smell in the air.

trait.name: Practiced Charismatic Speaker
entries: Jeholrak Politician has advantage on Charisma checks and Charisma saving throws.

action.name: Feeble Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1d4 + 2} bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Command Defend
entries: As an action, Jeholrak Politician may select a friendly non-Jeholrak Politician creature within 30 ft. of it. That creature may move up to its maximum walking speed and take an action.

monster.name: Jeholrak Infiltrator
languages: any two languages (usually Common and Archosauric)
Thieves' cant

trait.name: Pheromonal Influence
entries: Jeholrak Infiltrator may cast the following spells using Charisma as its spellcasting ability (with a spell save DC of 13).
2/day each: {@spell charm person}, {@spell animal friendship}.
1/day: {@spell suggestion}.
Jeholrak Infiltrator may cast these spells without components (even while appearing as a Jeholrak Politician). The only indication that anything is happening is a slightly sweet smell in the air.

trait.name: In Plain Sight
entries: When first encountered, the Jeholrak Infiltrator will be disguised as an unarmed Jeholrak Politician. A passive Perception of 18 will reveal that they are in fact an assassin. Alternatively, a Perception check of 15 or higher will reveal them if a player is actively looking.
The Jeholrak Infiltrator may choose to take on the disguise of a Jeholrak Politician instead of hiding when succeeding a Stealth check.

When Jeholrak Infiltrator attacks while disguised as a Jeholrak Politician, they attack with advantage and, if their first attack hits, it scores a critical hit. The disguise is then lost at the end of Jeholrak Infiltrator's turn.

trait.name: Flee The Scene!
entries: Jeholrak Infiltrator may dash, disengage, or hide as a bonus action.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: If Jeholrak Infiltrator chooses the attack action, it may make any two combinations of Gnarled Kriss or Razor Shuriken attacks.

action.name: Gnarled Kriss
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 2d4 + 4} piercing damage plus {@damage 2d6} poison damage. If this attack was made with advantage, it does an additional {@damage 2d6} piercing damage.

action.name: Razor Shuriken
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, range 50 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 2d4 + 4} slashing damage plus {@damage 1d6} poison damage. If this attack was made with advantage, it does an additional {@damage 2d6} slashing damage.

monster.name: Ankylier Forgemaster
languages: any two languages (usually Common and Archosauric)

trait.name: Osteoderms
entries: Ankylier Forgemaster's AC is increased by 3 (included above), but it cannot benefit from its Dexterity modifier to improve its AC.

trait.name: Rippling Muscles
entries: Ankylier Forgemaster has advantage on Strength checks, Strength saving throws, and Intimidation checks.

trait.name: Forge Master
entries: Ankylier Forgemaster is an expert blacksmith, has expertise with Smith's Tools, and resistance to fire damage (included above).

trait.name: Forge Armament
entries: Ankylier Forgemaster can create a metal +1 weapon or armour during a long rest, so long as it has the raw materials and an anvil.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: If Ankylier Forgemaster chooses the attack action, it can make two Forge Greatmaul attacks.

action.name: Forge Greatmaul (+1)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1d10 + 6} magical bludgeoning damage plus {@damage 3d6} fire damage.

legendary.name: Clubbed Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1d6 + 5} bludgeoning damage. A creature hit by this attack must succeed a {@dc 17} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

legendary.name: Give Order
entries: Ankylier Forgemaster can give a verbal command to an Ankylier Karl within 60 ft. that can hear it. That Ankylier Karl may then immediately move up to 25 ft. and perform an action.

monster.name: Ankylier Karl
languages: any one language (usually Common or Archosauric)

trait.name: Osteoderms
entries: Ankylier Karl's AC is increased by 3 (included above), but it cannot benefit from its Dexterity modifier to improve its AC.

trait.name: Show of Strength (1/Day)
entries: As a bonus action, for the next 1 minute Ankylier Karl may give itself advantage on its next Strength check or Strength saving throw, but if it does, it has disadvantage on its next Dexterity check or Dexterity saving throw.

trait.name: Impressive Physique
entries: Ankylier Karl has advantage on Intimidation checks.

action.name: Smith's Hammer
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1d6 + 1} bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Clubbed Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1d6 + 1} bludgeoning damage.

monster.name: Ankylier Enchanter
languages: any two languages (usually Common and Archosauric)

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Ankylier Enchanter's spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks). It may cast the following spells:

trait.name: Osteoderms
entries: Ankylier Enchanter's AC is increased by 3 (included above), but it cannot benefit from its Dexterity modifier to improve its AC.

trait.name: Industrial Enchanter
entries: When performing the Enchant Weapon or Enchant Armour action, Ankylier Enchanter may choose to spend an hour doing this instead of a single action. If it does so, the enchantment becomes permanent until replaced by a similar effect and is not lost when another weapon/armour is enchanted.

trait.name: Arcane Intuition
entries: Ankylier Enchanter has advantage on saving throws to prevent it from being {@condition charmed} or cursed.

action.name: Enchant Weapon
entries: Select a weapon that Ankylier Enchanter can see and is within 40 ft. of it. For the next 1 minute, that weapon deals an additional {@damage 1d6} damage of any type of your choosing. If that weapon already had this effect (or a similar effect) applied to it, the new effect temporarily overrides it. Only one weapon may be enchanted by this ability at a time and if a new weapon is enchanted, the effect ends on the previous one.

action.name: Enchant Armour
entries: Select a set of armour that Ankylier Enchanter can see and is within 40 ft. of it. For the next 1 minute, that armour provides the wearer with resistance to one damage type of your choosing. If that armour already had this effect (or a similar effect) applied to it, the new effect temporarily overrides it. Only one armour may be enchanted by this ability at a time and if a new armour is enchanted, the effect ends on the previous one.

action.name: Blessing Rod
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1d8 + 3} bludgeoning damage plus {@damage 2d6} force damage.

monster.name: Limukin Champion

resist.note: from nonmagical attacks; while in combat

languages: any two languages (usually Common and Archosauric)

trait.name: Parrying Guard
entries: When hit by a melee or ranged attack, as a reaction, Limukin Champion may attempt to deflect that attack with its Dinosaur-bone Greatsword. The damage of that incoming attack is reduced by {@dice 1d10}.

trait.name: Venomous Miasma
entries: A faint purple mist emanates from between Limukin Champion's armour plates. Each non-Limukin creature that starts its turn within or comes within 10 ft. of Limukin Champion must succeed a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. Limukin Champion is also immune to poison damage (included above) and has disadvantage on Stealth checks.

trait.name: Grapple Wire
entries: Limukin Champion can use a grappling rope to scale trees and traverse canopies with ease. It has a climbing speed of 30 ft. (included above) and can jump up to 25 ft. from standing still. This grapple can also be used to snare and pull at enemies.

trait.name: Raging
entries: While in combat, Limukin Champion has resistance to non-magical bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage (included above).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: If Limukin Champion chooses the attack action, it may make three attacks with its Dinosaur-bone Greatsword.

action.name: Dinosaur-bone Greatsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 2d6 + 5} slashing damage plus {@damage 1d10} poison damage.

action.name: Grapple Wire
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 60 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1d6 + 2} slashing damage. A Small or Medium creature hit by this attack is {@condition grappled} until the end of its next turn (escape {@dc 14}) and is pulled 10 ft. closer to Limukin Champion. If that creature was flying, it is pulled to the ground, but does not take falling damage.

monster.name: Limukin Worldshaper
languages: any two languages (usually Common and Archosauric)
Primordial

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Limukin Worldshaper's spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 14}, {@hit 6} to hit with spell attacks). It may cast the following spells:

trait.name: Venom Unbound
entries: When Limukin Worldshaper is reduced to 0 hit points, each non-Limukin creature within 20 ft. of it must succeed a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 6d6} poison damage and become {@condition poisoned} for 24 hours. On a success they take half as much damage and are not poisoned. Limukin Worldshaper is also resistant to poison damage (included above).

trait.name: Defender of the World
entries: Limukin Worldshaper has advantage on Wisdom saving throws and may attack with its Maelstrom Rod as a bonus action.

action.name: Maelstrom Rod
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 60 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 2d6 + 3} damage. Roll a {@dice d6} and consult the list below to determine the damage type of this attack:

items: {@bold 1.} Cold
{@bold 2.} Fire
{@bold 3.} Lightning
{@bold 4.} Thunder
{@bold 5.} Acid
{@bold 6.} Force

monster.name: Limukin Young Hunter
languages: any one language (usually Common or Archosauric)

trait.name: Toxic Secretion
entries: Any creature that hits Limukin Young Hunter with a melee attack suffers {@damage 1d4} poison damage. Limukin Young Hunter also has resistance to poison damage (included above).

trait.name: Young and Naive
entries: Limukin Young Hunter has disadvantage on Intelligence and Wisdom saving throws.

trait.name: Natural Hunter
entries: Limukin Young Hunter can use its Dexterity modifier for Nature, Perception, and Survival checks (included above).

action.name: Toxin-Coated Slingshot
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 3} to hit, range 30 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1d6 + 2} bludgeoning damage plus {@damage 1d4} poison damage.

action.name: Skinning Knife
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1d4 + 2} piercing damage.

action.name: Vinerope Net
entries: As an action, Limukin Young Hunter may throw a hooked and weighted net over a creature within 20 ft. That creature must succeed a {@dc 11} Dexterity saving throw or be {@condition restrained} (escape {@dc 11} Strength check).

monster.name: Dromeus Trader (Children of Seth)
languages: any four languages (usually Common, Archosauric, and two other languages)

trait.name: Haggle
entries: Dromeus Trader has advantage on Persuasion checks while negotiating prices.

trait.name: Uncommon Wares
entries: You may select one common or uncommon magic item for Dromeus Trader to have (DM's choice). It may use that item and can be convinced to sell it.

trait.name: Global Trader
entries: Dromeus Trader has proficiency in Athletics (included above) and may remove a level of {@condition exhaustion||exhaustion} after completing a short rest.

action.name: Bag'o'Coins
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 1} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1d4} bludgeoning damage. When a creature is hit by this attack {@dice 1d6} coins are scattered on the ground. Roll {@dice 1d4} and consult the list below to determine the type of coins:

items: {@bold 1.} Copper
{@bold 2.} Silver
{@bold 3.} Gold
{@bold 4.} Mysterious

monster.name: Dromeus Emissary (Children of Seth)
languages: any five languages (usually Common, Archosauric, and three other languages)

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Dromeus Emissary's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 12}, {@hit 4} to hit with spell attacks). It may cast the following spells:

trait.name: Diplomatic Immunity
entries: Dromeus Emissary is always considered to be friendly to law enforcementguards of any kind will defend it if able. Dromeus Emissary is also immune to charm effects (included above).

trait.name: Global Migrator
entries: Dromeus Emissary has proficiency in Athletics (included above).

action.name: Letter Opener
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1d4 + 1} piercing damage.

monster.name: Dromeus Memory-Keeper (Children of Seth)
languages: any four languages (usually Common, Archosauric, and two other languages)

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Dromeus Memory-Keeper's spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 16}, {@hit 8} to hit with spell attacks). It may cast the following spells:

trait.name: Mind's Eye
entries: Dromeus Memory-Keeper is able to glimpse into the thoughts of nearby creatures, so long as they are focused on it. Melee attacks against Dromeus Memory-Keeper are made at disadvantage and Dromeus Memory-Keeper has advantage on Intelligence saving throws.

trait.name: Split Focus
entries: Dromeus Memory-Keeper may make an attack with its Ceremonial Memory-Channelling Staff as a bonus action.

trait.name: Global Migrator
entries: Dromeus Memory-Keeper has proficiency in Athletics (included above).

action.name: Ceremonial Memory-Channelling Staff
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 8} to hit, range 50 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1d10} psychic damage. A creature hit by this attack must succeed a {@dc 12} Intelligence saving throw or take an additional {@damage 1d10} psychic damage.

resist.note: falling damage only; while not incapacitated

entries.name: Age
entries: Pluvenn live for 4050 years and mature at the age of 11 or 12.

entries.name: Size
entries: Your size is Small or Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Creature Type
entries: You are a humanoid. You are considered a dinosaur for any prerequisite or effect that requires you to be a dinosaur.

entries.name: Razormaw
entries: Your teeth are natural weapons. You can use these to make unarmed strikes, dealing {@damage 1d4} + your Dexterity modifier piercing damage, instead of the bludgeoning damage that you would normally deal for an unarmed strike.

entries.name: Grappleclaws
entries: Large recurved claws on each of your feet help you to climb, as well as grapple foes. You have advantage on ability checks to grapple a creature, as well as Athletics checks for climbing. While grappling a creature, you can use your bonus action to inflict {@damage 1d4} + PB piercing damage to that creature.

entries.name: Nocturnal/Diurnal
entries: You have {@sense darkvision} out to 60 ft. and only require 4 hours to complete a long rest.

entries.name: Pneumatised and Feathered
entries: As long as you are not {@condition incapacitated}, you are resistant to falling damage.

entries.name: Custom Lineage
entries: Adventurers are, by their very nature, exceptional. When playing a Pluvenn character, you may replace the Racial Abilities Razormaw, Grappleclaws, and Pneumatised and Feathered with a single feat. We advise agreeing this with your dungeon master before doing so.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You know Archosauric and Common in addition to any other languages you know.

entries.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: If you have not already selected ability score improvements earlier in character creation, you may increase your Dexterity by 3. Alternatively, you may increase one ability score by 2 and another one by 1, or you may increase three different ability scores by 1.

entries.name: Age
entries: Manyhorn live for between 40 and 120 years, and mature between 15 and 32 years old, depending on their specific species, with larger species generally living longer.

entries.name: Size
entries: Your size is Small or Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Creature Type
entries: You are a humanoid. You are considered a dinosaur for any prerequisite or effect that requires you to be a dinosaur.

entries.name: Musclebound
entries: You count as one size category larger than your current size for determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can manoeuvre.

entries.name: Guild Connections
entries: When entering a new city, town, or other major settlement, roll a {@dice d4}. You gain the associated benefit below while you are there:

items: {@bold 1.} You can find simple overnight accommodation for yourself and your party for free.
{@bold 2.} Prices are 10% cheaper for you and your party.
{@bold 3.} Town guards will be more lenient with you and your party.
{@bold 4.} One NPC will share uncommon information with you and your party.

entries.name: Head Crest
entries: You are proficient in Intimidation checks. You can use your bonus action to flood your crest with blood, causing it to display bright pinks and reds. If you do, you gain advantage on Intimidation checks for the next minute.

entries.name: Horned Repose
entries: If an enemy fails to hit you with a melee attack while within 5 ft. of you, you may use your reaction to make a single unarmed attack back at them with your horns. You are proficient with your horns and they have the Finesse property. They deal {@damage 1d6} + Strength/Dexterity modifier piercing damage. From level 10 onwards, you can add your proficiency bonus to the damage as well.

entries.name: Custom Lineage
entries: Adventurers are, by their very nature, exceptional. When playing a Manyhorn character, you may replace the Racial Abilities Guild Connections and Horned Repose with a single feat. We advise agreeing this with your dungeon master before doing so.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You know Archosauric, Common, and another language of your choice in addition to any other languages you know.

entries.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: If you have not already selected ability score improvements earlier in character creation, you may increase your Strength by 1, Constitution by 1, and Wisdom by 1. Alternatively, you may increase one ability score by 2 and another one by 1, or you may increase three different ability scores by 1.

entries.name: Age
entries: Jeholrak typically live up to 50 years old and mature at 1617 years old. Although this is largely a result of the competitive nature of their society. If isolated, an individual Jeholrak could live to their late 70s or early 80s.

entries.name: Size
entries: Your size is Small.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Creature Type
entries: You are a humanoid. You are considered a dinosaur for any prerequisite or effect that requires you to be a dinosaur.

entries.name: Power of Persuasion
entries: To the untrained eye, it appears that Jeholrak are blessed with impeccable persuasive skills. The reality is that they are able to produce hypnotic pheromones that can subdue those around them.

When you reach certain levels, you can manifest this ability in the form of the spells listed below. You can cast one of these spells once (at the spell's minimum level) without using a spell slot or requiring components, then require a long rest before you may do so again. When you cast this spell, the only indication that something is happening is a faint sweet smell. Your spellcasting ability for these spells is Charisma, Constitution, or Wisdom (your choice) and these spells are ineffective against other Jeholrak.

items: Level 1: {@spell charm person}
Level 5: {@spell suggestion}

entries.name: Cutthroat Society
entries: The Jeholrak of Mount Karao'kr can be dastardly in their backstabbing (sometimes literally) to achieve their goals.

You have advantage on Sleight of Hand checks. Additionally, as a bonus action, you may hide a small one-handed weapon or item on your person that can only be detected by a successful Investigation check, or by any magical means. The DC for this check is equal to 8 + your Dexterity modifier + your proficiency bonus.

entries.name: Subdue Beast
entries: You have advantage on Animal Handling checks and can cast the spell {@spell animal friendship} a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus without using a spell slot. Your spellcasting ability for this spell is Charisma, Constitution, or Wisdom (your choice), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Custom Lineage
entries: Adventurers are, by their very nature, exceptional. When playing a Jeholrak character, you may replace the Racial Abilities Power of Persuasion and Cutthroat Society listed above with a single feat of your choice. We advise agreeing this with your dungeon master before doing so.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You know Archosauric and Common in addition to any other languages you know.

entries.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: If you have not already selected ability score improvements earlier in character creation, you may increase your Charisma by 2 and your Dexterity by 1. Alternatively, you may increase one ability score by 2 and another one by 1, or you may increase three different ability scores by 1.

entries.name: Age
entries: Ankylier live for between 110 and 130 years. They enter Ankylier society at about 12 years old, and fully mature at around 25 years old.

entries.name: Size
entries: Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 25 feet.

entries.name: Creature Type
entries: You are a humanoid. You are considered a dinosaur for any prerequisite or effect that requires you to be a dinosaur.

entries.name: Musclebound
entries: You count as a large creature for determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can manoeuvre.

entries.name: Clubbed Tail
entries: When you attack, you may replace any of your attacks with a tail attack. This is a melee weapon attack that you are proficient with and uses your Strength modifier to hit, dealing {@damage 1d6} + Strength modifier bludgeoning damage. From level 10 onwards, you can add your proficiency bonus to the damage.

entries.name: Metalworker
entries: You have proficiency with smith's tools and medium armour. You can create a single shield, simple weapon, martial weapon, or medium armour over the course of a long rest, provided you have access to materials and a forge. If you use this time to create an item in this manner, you only gain the benefits of a short rest.

entries.name: Osteoderms
entries: You have thick, bony osteoderms in your skin. You gain +3 to your AC, but cannot add your Dexterity modifier to your AC. Alternatively, you may have an unarmoured AC of 17, but cannot add your Dexterity modifier to your AC. We suggest agreeing which of these you use with your DM.

entries.name: Custom Lineage
entries: Adventurers are, by their very nature, exceptional. When playing an Ankylier character, you may replace the Racial Abilities Musclebound and Metalworker with a single feat that provides at least one tool proficiency. This could lead to a powerful character, so we strongly recommend that you agree this with your dungeon master before doing so.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You know Archosauric and Common in addition to any other languages you know.

entries.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: If you have not already selected ability score improvements earlier in character creation, you may increase your Constitution by 3, or your Constitution by 2 and your Strength by 1. Alternatively, you may increase one ability score by 2 and another one by 1, or you may increase three different ability scores by 1.

entries.name: Age
entries: Limukin have short lifespans and mature quickly. They reach adult-size at between 6 and 8 years old, although are not fully mature until they reach 9 or 10 years old. They typically live until their early 20s. The oldest elders will be in their late 20s to early 30s.

entries.name: Size
entries: Your size is Small or Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Creature Type
entries: You are a humanoid. You are considered a dinosaur for any prerequisite or effect that requires you to be a dinosaur.

entries.name: Hunter-Gatherer
entries: You have advantage on Stealth and Survival checks while in a forest, wood, jungle, or otherwise heavily-vegetated area. If you are familiar with the vegetated habitat you are in, you can forage twice as much food as you normally would be able to (this ability stacks with other similar abilities).

entries.name: Envenomed Weapons
entries: As an action, you can coat your weapon (or up to 5 ammunition) with a powerful venom you secrete, envenoming it. When a creature is damaged by an envenomed weapon or ammunition, it must succeed a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 2d4} poison damage and be {@condition poisoned} for one minute. At level 5, this poison damage is increased to {@damage 3d4}. The DC for this save is equal to 10 + your proficiency bonus.
The poison lasts for 1 minute on the weapon or ammunition, as it loses its potency after it dries. You can use this ability once, then require a long rest before you can do so again.

entries.name: Watcher's Eyes
entries: You have {@sense darkvision} out to 60 ft.

entries.name: Innate Toxicology
entries: You have resistance to poison damage and have advantage on any check or saving throw to avoid or end the {@condition poisoned} condition.

entries.name: Custom Lineage
entries: Adventurers are, by their very nature, exceptional. When playing a Limukin character, you may replace the Racial Abilities Hunter-Gatherer and Envenomed Weapons with a single feat of your choice. We advise agreeing this with your dungeon master before doing so.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You know Archosauric and Common in addition to any other languages you know.

entries.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: If you have not already selected ability score improvements earlier in character creation, you may increase your Dexterity by 2 and your Constitution by 1. Alternatively, you may increase one ability score by 2 and another one by 1, or you may increase three different ability scores by 1.

entries.name: Age
entries: Children of Seth live for between 300 and 400 years. They mature at around 50 years old.

entries.name: Size
entries: Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Creature Type
entries: You are a humanoid. You are considered a dinosaur and pterosaur for any prerequisite or effect that requires you to be a dinosaur or pterosaur.

entries.name: Flight
entries: You are capable of flight and have a fly speed of 30 ft. This is reduced to 20 ft. if you are wearing medium or heavy armour.

entries.name: Global Migrators
entries: You have proficiency in Athletics. So long as you can see the sky, you always know which way North is.

entries.name: Verbal Culture
entries: The Children of Seth have excellent memories and can recall details from years ago with relative accuracy. You have proficiency in two of the following skills: {@skill Arcana}, {@skill Religion}, {@skill History}. Alternatively, you may have expertise in one of them instead. You remember every person you have interacted with, including their name if you learnt it.

entries.name: Well-Travelled
entries: You know the value of any trade goods at a glance, so long as you have come across them before.

entries.name: Custom Lineage
entries: Adventurers are, by their very nature, exceptional. When playing a Children of Seth character, you may replace the Racial Abilities Global Migrators, Verbal Culture, and Well-Travelled with a single feat of your choice. We advise agreeing this with your dungeon master before doing so.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You know Archosauric, Common, and two other languages of your choice in addition to any other languages you know.

entries.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: If you have not already selected ability score improvements earlier in character creation, you may increase your Wisdom by 2 and your Strength by 1. Alternatively, you may increase one ability score by 2 and another one by 1, or you may increase three different ability scores by 1.

background.name: Time-Lost

_.special: a pair of gold bracelets worth 7 gp each

items.name: Equipment
items.entry: A bone-dagger, {@item club|phb}, simple loin cloth, {@item herbalism kit|phb}, a gold necklace worth 30 gp, and a pair of gold bracelets worth 7 gp each

entries: The time-lost are those unfortunate individuals who have been propelled through time, either by accident or against their will. They find themselves in a strange land, surrounded by unfamiliar cultures and creatures.

entries.name: Feature: Way of the Wild
entries: While in an environment that is the same type as your origin, you are not slowed by difficult terrain generated by that environment.

entries.name: Environmental Origin
entries: In your previous time, you inhabited a particular environment and are most familiar with that terrain type. Roll a {@dice d8} and consult the table below or choose whichever you find most appealing.

rows: Jungle
You are unbothered by trekking through thick undergrowth.
Forest
You have a fondness of foraging for wild berries in forests.
Desert
The desert sun feels wonderful on your face and you like to bask in it.
Tundra
Getting chilly outside makes for a warmer, more welcoming, hearth at home.
Mountainous
You enjoy taking the difficult route, so long as it gives the best view.
Riverside
Catching fish is one of your favourite pastimes and is second nature to you.
Seafaring
You love diving and collect exotic shells you find on the seafloor.
Plains
You always enjoy the calming breeze blowing across the plains.

entries.name: Suggested Starting Feat and Ability Scores
entries: If you use your background to determine your ability score increases and provide a starting feat, we recommend the following:

items: {@bold Feat:} {@feat Alert} or {@feat Naturalist|DrDhrolinsDictionaryofDinosaurs}.
{@bold Ability Scores:} +2 Constitution, +1 Wisdom or Strength.

entries.name: Suggested Tool: Survivalist's Kit
entries: {@i Common, 1 gp, 9 lb.} This kit is used to carefully extract resources and medicines from plants and animals. It consists of a small flint-knapped blade, wooden tweezers, water-proof pouches, and adhesives. The kit provides expertise with Medicine checks, so long as you are in an environment with abundant plants/animals/fungi.

entries.name: Suggested Characteristics
entries: The time-lost come from many different periods of time, environments, and cultures. However, they all share a lack of knowledge of the modern world. How they respond to that lack of knowledge differs  they may find things frightening, exciting, or uninteresting.

entries.caption: Personality Traits
rows: I'm fearful of new technologies.
I love to collect beautiful feathers and adorn my clothes/armour with them.
Gold is commonplace to me, and I find it boring.
I find slaying certain creatures reprehensible.
I venerate creatures of great power.
Every new piece of technology is extremely interesting to me, but also confusing.
The sounds of a city keep me awake at night.
I keep the teeth of monsters I slay on a necklace or bracelet.

entries.caption: Ideals
rows: I see myself as nature's protector. I want to bond with and protect the modern wilds.
I see myself as an explorer and there are so many new things to discover!
I'm an expert hunter. I want to find this time's most dangerous beast, and hunt it!
I'd like to return home. I need to learn about time travel and how I got here.
I seek to gain as much power and prominence as I can in this new time.
I miss the good ol' days. I want to change this world to be more like my time.

entries.caption: Bonds
rows: I must find a way to return to my time.
My ancestors are out there somewhere. I must find them and reunite.
This new world is so strange, I'd like to explore what it has become.
There's a bounty of wealth that I never could have imagined, I'd like to sample it.
I'm the last of my kin. I must re-establish my clan/tribe.
I left without settling a score. I must find out whether my old enemy was destroyed.

entries.caption: Flaws
rows: In my savage world, those who fell behind were left behind. I keep to this code.
I'm fearful of technology, it seems like evil magic to me.
I'm from a violent time, I act quickly and violently, worrying about consequences later.
I'm naive about the dangers of this world.
I think these modern comforts make people weak.
I'm gluttonous with the bounty of all this exotic food!

background.name: Geologist

_.special: a reinforced backpack that increases your carry weight by 20 lb.

items.name: Tool Proficiencies
items.entry: Mason's tools, Cartographer's tools, Excavator's Tools, and Analysis Tools

items.name: Equipment
items.entry: A shovel, a miner's pick, a hammer and chisel, a reinforced backpack that increases your carry weight by 20 lb., gemstones worth 25 gp, and an additional 10 gp in coins

entries: Geologists are those who have dedicated a portion of their lives to the study of rocks and earthly processes. They are able to see beyond the immediately obvious and interpret the landscape around them, providing valuable field knowledge.

entries.name: Feature: Eye for Faults
entries: Years of studying geology allows you to easily select weak points in rock, allowing you to break it and tunnel with ease. You have a tunnelling speed of 5 ft.

entries.name: Feature: Rock Knowledge
entries: You can identify any rocks or gemstones at a glance, and know their value.

entries.name: Rock Specialism
entries: Your previous work as a geologist has given you a type of rock that you're particularly passionate about. Roll a {@dice d8} and consult the table below or choose whichever you find most appealing.

rows: Fluvial
You love the sediments of rivers and streams and relish the opportunity to spend time wading in them. You're aware of the dangers of flooding.
Volcanic
The dramatic power of volcanoes excites you. You love to explore volcanic settings, but are wary of their dangers.
Calcareous
You love delving into natural caves, particularly those hollowed out by groundwater, but are very observant of potential cave-ins.
Shale
Deepwater sediments are your speciality. You jump at the opportunity to deep-dive into water, particularly in the ocean, and are a great swimmer.
Plutonic
You greatly enjoy walking on rolling hills, moors, and tors, and will favour taking longer routes if they take you over this terrain.
Metamorphic
You are particularly excited by sharp jagged metamorphosed rocks and can navigate them with ease.
Seams
You have a fixation on rare minerals and gemstones that can be found within rich rock seams. You will go out of your way to acquire rare gemstones.
Orogenous
You love mountains and mountain-climbing, and are very good at it. You always want to climb to the very top, if you can.

entries.name: Suggested Starting Feat and Ability Scores
entries: If you use your background to determine your ability score increases and provide a starting feat, we recommend the following:

items: {@bold Feat:} {@feat Tough} or {@feat Miner|DrDhrolinsDictionaryofDinosaurs}.
{@bold Ability Scores:} +2 Constitution or Strength, +1 Intelligence.

entries.name: Suggested Tools
entries: {@bold Excavator's Tools:} {@i Common, 5 gp, 8 lb.} These tools are used to carefully extract fossils or minerals from rock/mud/dirt. They cause your harvested gemstones to be 10% more valuable and harvested fossils to be 100% more valuable.

{@bold Analysis Tools:} {@i Common, 10 gp, 1 lb.} These tools provide a +2 to any skill check where you are examining an object small enough to fit into your hand, regardless of the skill you are using.

entries.name: Suggested Characteristics
entries: Geologists come in many varieties. Below are some suggestions for traits, ideals, bonds, and flaws that a geologist may have.

entries.caption: Personality Traits
rows: Exploration is everything, I have to get out there and find new things.
I fancy myself as an adventurer, but I'm not as surefooted as I think I am.
I'm more of a bookworm, reading about other people's work and adventures.
Given the option between taking a tunnel and climbing a mountain, I'll always take the tunnel!
If it's in the ground, it's anyone's fair game!
I find anything geology related interesting and pick up little rocks everywhere I go.
I don't like clean-nosed, stuck-up scientists of other fields.
We dig rocks, then we drink lots!

entries.caption: Ideals
rows: I'm an academic at heart, I want to know everything there is about the deep past.
I'm a naturalist at heart. Look at the beauty of our world  isn't it remarkable?!
I love spelunking. There're treasures beyond measure down in the depths.
I only work as a contractor. I've got to get the job done, everything else is secondary.
I'm on the run as a lawbreaker. They'll never find me if I'm deep underground.
I'm going to find the riches of a lifetime  there's gold in them-there mountains, I can feel it.

entries.caption: Bonds
rows: My parent was a famous geologist  I'm following in their footsteps.
Our world is sacred, both in the present and past.
My mentor expects big things from me, I don't want to disappoint.
I want to see firsthand the most impressive geological events  eruptions, earthquakes, and landslides!
If I can find the biggest, most precious gem, perhaps I can finally impress the person of my dreams.
The ancient past has mesmerised me, ever since I was a child.

entries.caption: Flaws
rows: I can only sleep in total darkness, usually with my head buried under something.
I can't resist expensive gemstones. They must be mine!
I get overly obsessed with tunnelling, always wanting to dig deeper.
I'm surprisingly destructive  getting to the rocks is what matters, things in the way be damned!
I have no regard for the laws of the land when it comes to my research.
My only loyalty is to whoever is paying me for my work.

background.name: Palaeontologist

_.special: plaster of Paris with medical bandages
a fist-sized fossil (bone fragment, claw, skull, ammonite, or trilobite)

items.name: Tool Proficiencies
items.entry: Mason's tools, Cartographer's tools, and Research Scrolls

items.name: Equipment
items.entry: A shovel, a miner's pick, a brush, plaster of Paris with medical bandages, a fist-sized fossil (bone fragment, claw, skull, ammonite, or trilobite), a traveller's {@item backpack|phb}, a tankard, and 20 gp in coins

entries: Palaeontologists are those who have dedicated a portion of their lives to the study of ancient organisms and environments. They are able to interpret how creatures may behave, based on their morphology.

entries.name: Feature: Natural Historian
entries: You have advantage on History checks that involve animals or the natural world.

entries.name: Feature: Hazard Training
entries: You are acutely aware of geological hazards and have proficiency on saving throws against geological hazards (i.e. falling from cliffs, escaping landslides, cave-ins, etc.).

entries.name: Palaeontological Specialism
entries: In addition to being a general palaeontologist, you also specialise in one particular area of palaeontology. Roll a {@dice d6} and consult the table below or choose whichever you find most appealing.

rows: Theropoda
You can instantly recognise if a beast is carnivorous and likely to be hostile to you if you approach it further.
Cladistics
You can tell if a beast has been unnaturally altered or is not behaving of its own accord.
Ornithischia
Years of studying herbivores has given you insight into their behaviour. You can tell if they're likely to be hostile when approached.
Palaeobotany
You are able to recognise if a plant or plant-based creature may be dangerous.
Arthropoda
You can tell if large arthropods (i.e. giant spiders, giant scorpions, giant crabs etc.) inhabit an area.
Taphonomy
When encountering a carcass, you can easily tell how long the creature has been dead for.

entries.name: Suggested Starting Feat and Ability Scores
entries: If you use your background to determine your ability score increases and provide a starting feat, we recommend the following:

items: {@bold Feat:} {@feat Naturalist|DrDhrolinsDictionaryofDinosaurs} or {@feat Miner|DrDhrolinsDictionaryofDinosaurs}.
{@bold Ability Scores:} +1 Wisdom, +1 Intelligence, +1 Constitution.

entries.name: Suggested Tool: Research Scrolls
entries: {@i Uncommon, 50 gp, 2 lb.} A collection of research scrolls on your chosen topic. When using these scrolls, select one skill from History, Arcana, Nature, or Religion. If you spend 10 minutes studying the scrolls, you gain temporary proficiency in the selected skill (or expertise if you are already proficient) for the next 6 hours. If you already have expertise in that skill, these do not provide any benefit.

entries.name: Suggested Characteristics
entries: Palaeontologists come in many varieties. Below are some suggestions for traits, ideals, bonds, and flaws that a palaeontologist may have.

entries.caption: Personality Traits
rows: I talk about fossils all the time, much to the annoyance of my friends.
I like to watch modern animal behaviour to learn how ancient animals behaved.
I'm always looking at the ground in front of me, just in case I spot a fossil.
I sometimes find myself staring into the distance, imagining what this area may have looked like millions of years ago.
Whenever we visit a city, the museum is the first place I want to go.
I love to doodle sketches of dinosaurs.
I keep fossils as jewellery and wear them all the time.
Whenever I meet a new creature, I'm always trying to figure out its place in the tree of life.

entries.caption: Ideals
rows: I see myself as a 'Gentleman Scientist'. Studying these ancient creatures is a pastime that should be reserved for the academic elite.
Anyone with a trowel and the right attitude can do it! Let's get in the dirt.
There are wonders in our past that few people know about  I want to show them to everyone!
I'm a big fossil fan. Big teeth and big claws are what matter to me.
I want to be the name behind an awesome dinosaur.
I'm a fossil dealer. These fossils have great value, and I can make my living selling them, even if it has to be done shadily.

entries.caption: Bonds
rows: Theropoda. Sharp-toothed predatory dinosaurs excite you the most.
Sauropoda. Giant long-necked dinosaurs excite you the most.
Thyreophora. Heavily armoured dinosaurs excite you the most.
Marginocephalian. Crested and horned dinosaurs excite you the most.
Pterosauria. Flying reptiles excite you the most.
Sauropterygia. Marine reptiles excite you the most.

entries.caption: Flaws
rows: I'm a Splitter. Whenever I meet a non-humanoid creature, I always assume it's a new species and am wary of new abilities and behaviours it might have.
I'm a Lumper. I often assume that groups of similar beasts will all behave in the same way.
I'm overly experimental, setting up little vials of acid with rocks sizzling in them wherever I rest.
I have a clumsy swing. I'm prone to hurting myself when trying to smash rocks.
I'm a bit vacant. My head is so stuck in the past that I often lose interest in conversation and daydream about ancient worlds.
I'm jaded. I've seen so many bones and carcasses that the sight of a dead body doesn't bother me in the slightest.

feat.name: Naturalist
entries: {@i 1st-Level Feat. Repeatable: No.}

entries.name: Taxonomist
entries: When rolling a Survival check to identify the remains of any beast, plant, or humanoid, any roll of a 19 is treated as a 10.

entries.name: Fieldwork
entries: You have expertise in Survival checks when tracking a beast.

entries.name: Functional Morphology
entries: The first time you encounter a beast that you have not seen before, you are able to discern either its AC, maximum hit points, or one resistance it has (your choice).

feat.name: Miner
entries: {@i 1st-Level Feat. Repeatable: No.}

entries.name: Portable Lamp
entries: You possess a physical lamp that weighs 1 lb. and can produce 20 ft. of bright light and a further 20 ft. of dim light. The lamp attaches to your belt/armour and does not need to be carried.

entries.name: Familiar Rumble
entries: While underground, you have a {@sense tremorsense} of 30 ft. If you already have tremorsense, its range is increased by 20 ft.

entries.name: "Cave-in!"
entries: You have advantage on any skill check or saving throw to escape falling natural rocks (i.e. from cliffs, caves, tunnels, etc., but not from traps or buildings).

feat.name: Stone-whisperer
entries: {@i 4th-Level Feat. Repeatable: No.}

entries.name: Stone Whisper
entries: You can cast the {@spell stone shape} spell once per day without requiring material components and without using a spell slot. This is increased to three times per day at level 10, five times per day at level 15, and an unlimited number of times per day at level 20.

entries.name: Whisper Back
entries: You have a {@sense tremorsense} of 10 ft.

feat.name: Behaviourist
entries: {@i 4th-Level Feat. Repeatable: No.}

entries.name: Animal Behaviour Expert
entries: You have expertise in Animal Handling checks.

entries.name: Bespoke Saddles
entries: Creatures you tame gain +1 to their AC, hit rolls, and damage.

feat.name: Crocodile Wrangler
entries: {@i 8th-Level Feat. Repeatable: No.}

entries.name: Bush Wrangler
entries: You gain +1 to your Constitution or Strength score.

entries.name: "What a beauty!"
entries: You have advantage on Animal Handling checks and advantage on checks to grapple beasts.

entries.name: "Crikey!"
entries: Any Large, Medium, or Small beast you are grappling cannot select you as a target for its attacks.

feat.name: Volcanologist
entries: {@i 8th-Level Feat. Repeatable: No.}

entries.name: Heat Handler
entries: You gain resistance to fire damage.

entries.name: Assess Volcano
entries: If you can see a volcano, you may take 10 minutes to assess it. If you do, you are able to determine whether it is likely to erupt in either the next >100 years, 10 years, 1 year, 30 days, 7 days, or 24 hours. If the volcano is going to erupt in the next 7 days or less, you are able to determine the minimum safe distance from it.

feat.name: Action Hero
entries: {@i 12th-Level Feat. Repeatable: No.}

entries.name: Catch Jaws
entries: If a creature hits you with an attack that uses its mouth (i.e. a bite or maw attack), you can use your reaction to reduce any incoming damage by {@dice 1d10} + your level.

entries.name: Heroic Moment
entries: The first time you fail an Athletics check each day, you may choose to succeed it instead.

activation.condition: When you take damage from a bite or maw attack
First failed Athletics check each day

feat.name: Arcane Enchanter
entries: {@i 12th-Level Feat. Repeatable: No.}

entries.name: Enchant
entries: As an action, you can select an item you can see and touch, and enchant it. You may only have a single item enchanted at any given point, and when you use this action, any previous enchants you have made end. The item gains one of the following enchantments based on its type:

items: {@bold Weapon:} For the next minute that weapon deals {@damage 1d6} additional damage of any damage type that your spells can deal. At level 16, you may add your proficiency bonus to this additional damage.

{@bold Armour:} For the next minute that armour provides the wearer with resistance to one damage type that your spells can deal. At level 16, you may select two damage types that this armour provides resistance to.

{@bold Wondrous:} For the next minute, that item provides the bearer advantage on saving throws and checks to prevent or end a condition of your choice. At level 16, you may select two conditions that this item provides advantage for.

subclassFeature.name: Big Game Hunter
entries: The Big Game Hunter is an individual who has honed their tracking and ranged attack skills to become a fierce monster slayer. Rather than specialising in slaying particular types of creatures, they instead focus on how to levy a creatures size against it  the bigger they are, the harder they fall.

subclassFeature.name: Ranged Specialist
entries: You gain proficiency with all ranged weapons (including thrown weapons and firearms), however you lose proficiency with all melee weapons. If a weapon can be used as both melee and ranged, you are only proficient when using it for a ranged attack (even when in melee range). If you selected Duelling as your Fighting Style, it is now applicable to dual wielded, single-handed ranged weapons (such as throwing knives, thrown hand axes, hand crossbows, etc.), but not melee weapons, or you can re-select a different Fighting Style.
Additionally, you may use a ranged weapon while an enemy is within 5 ft. of you without disadvantage.

subclassFeature.name: Game Hunter
entries: You replace your Favoured Enemy type with Favoured Enemy (Large Creatures). At 6th level, instead of selecting another Favoured Enemy, you gain Favoured Enemy (Huge Creatures). At 14th level, instead of selecting another Favoured Enemy, you also gain Favoured Enemy (Gargantuan Creatures). At each of these intervals, you may learn one language associated with a creature of that size that you have slain (if it has languages).

subclassFeature.name: Bolas
entries: When making a ranged attack against a target creature of size Large or larger, on a hit, you may wrap a bolas around the creature, reducing its speed to 0 instead of dealing damage. On its turn, the creature may attempt to break the bolas using its bonus action. To do so, it must succeed a Strength check with a DC equal to 8 + your Dexterity modifier + your proficiency bonus. You may remove the bolas as an action if you are within 5 ft. of the creature. You may use this ability a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, then require a short or long rest to regain all expended uses.

subclassFeature.name: Special Shot
entries: You have a number of charges of Special Shot equal to your proficiency bonus and regain all spent charges after you complete a long rest. When you make a ranged attack, you may use a charge of Special Shot to apply one of the following effects:

items: {@bold Drill Shot:} This attack receives an additional +5 to the hit roll.

{@bold Trick Shot:} If you know approximately where a creature is (through sound, {@sense blindsight}, or knowledge of their location etc.), they are in range, and your ammunition can reach them in an uninterrupted path, then they do not gain the benefits for half and three-quarter cover, and full cover instead provides them with a +5 to their AC.

{@bold Power Shot:} Do not roll damage for this attack. Instead you cause the maximum damage you could roll on a successful hit. If you critically hit the creature, you still roll the additional damage dice.

subclassFeature.name: The Hunt Continues
entries: After killing a Favoured Enemy, you gain temporary hit points equal to twice your proficiency bonus. These temporary hit points are lost after completing a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Improved Bolas
entries: You may double your proficiency bonus to the DC required of the Strength check to break your bolas.

subclassFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: You can attack three times, rather than twice, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

subclassFeature.name: Special Shot Improvement
entries: You have a number of charges of Special Shot equal to twice your proficiency bonus, rather than just equal to your proficiency bonus.

subclassFeature.name: Apex Predator
entries: You have advantage on attacks against a Favoured Enemy. At a glance you know how many hit points a Favoured Enemy has remaining. Additionally, while your {@spell hunter's mark} is active on a living target and you are pursuing that target, you do not need to sleep or eat.

subclassFeature.name: Finish the Hunt
entries: As an action, you can declare that you are attempting to finish a target off. Select a creature that you can see, is within 60 ft., unobscured, and your Favoured Enemy. You make a single ranged attack against the creature that automatically hits so long as your character (and you) say a quip or one-liner, such as "This one's mine!", "I've got you now", or "Hasta la vista.". If you do not provide a quip or one-liner, the attack misses.

If a creature hit by this attack has less than 100 hit points remaining, it dies instantly. If it has 100 or more hit points, it instead takes {@damage 10d10 + 30} piercing damage. Once you use this ability, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Bonesculptor
entries: This gory reimagining of a blacksmith makes armour, weapons, and trinkets from the carcasses of slain great creatures. Through a combination of runic enhancements and harnessing the life essence of the slain beast, they are able to imbue their designs with potent magical energies.

entries.caption: Bonesculptor Spells
rows: 3rd
{@spell Cause Fear|XGE}, {@spell Inflict Wounds}, {@spell Speak with Animals}
5th
{@spell Wither and Bloom|SCC}, {@spell Gentle Repose}
9th
{@spell Animate Dead}, {@spell Speak with Dead}
13th
{@spell Death Ward}
17th
{@spell Raise Dead}, {@spell Commune with Nature}, {@spell Danse Macabre|XGE}

subclassFeature.name: Body Knowledge
entries: You have advantage on {@skill Medicine} checks, and you know the cantrip {@spell spare the dying} in addition to your other cantrips.

subclassFeature.name: Grim Harvest
entries: You can harvest resources from slain creatures that you may use to craft items. The table below outlines suggestions for managing the resources harvested from a creature and how long it takes to harvest from that creature. When harvesting, the DM may decide (or roll) how much, if any, of that resource you can harvest within the appropriate range of values. These are just guidelines, and we recommend that you discuss this with your DM when the moment arises.
Your allies may assist you in harvesting. If at least two other humanoids assist you in harvesting, you may halve the harvest time taken for each creature you harvest from.

entries.caption: Creature Harvest Table
rows: Tiny
3 minutes
Small
6 minutes
Medium
15 minutes
Large
A short rest
Huge
A long rest
Gargantuan
One day

subclassFeature.name: Melder of Flesh and Bone
entries: You gain proficiency in Heavy Armour, Leatherworker's tools, and Smith's tools if you did not have them already. You can craft armour, shields, and weapons from the parts of slain creatures. The table below outlines suggestions for the resource requirements for crafting these items and you must use Leatherworker's tools and Smith's tools to do so. These are just guidelines, and we recommend that you discuss this with your DM when the moment arises.
You can craft a single item during a long rest. During this time, you may apply any other improvements to that item that your class would allow.

entries.caption: Suggested Crafting Table
rows: Simple Medium Armour
Hide Armour or Scale Mail
4 Hide or Skin, 1 Feathers or Scales
Complex Medium Armour
Breastplate or Half Plate
4 Hide or Skin, 1 Bone or Chitin, 2 Feathers or Scales
Simple Heavy Armour

Large Weapon

Huge Weapon
