Trinket
Necklace, Ring, Dice
1 Horn/Fangs/Claws/Mandibles + 1 Hide/Skin

subclassFeature.name: Butcher
entries: You gain proficiency in one weapon type of your choosing. When making an attack roll, if you are attacking with a weapon that you crafted, you may use your Intelligence modifier instead of Strength or Dexterity for both the bonuses to hit and to damage.

subclassFeature.name: Improved Crafting
entries: You better understand the creation of items from flesh and bone. The items you craft using your Melder of Flesh and Bone ability become +1 items of their respective type.

subclassFeature.name: Construct of Flesh
entries: During a long rest, you may craft a Construct of Flesh instead of an item. This requires 4 hide/skin, 4 bone/chitin, and any combination of 4 horns, feathers, scales, fangs, claws, or mandibles.

The Construct of Flesh is a friendly undead companion that obeys your commands. It is a Medium creature with the appearance of your choice (although usually fairly gruesome) and the statistics outlined below. You may only have a single Construct of Flesh at a time. If you create a second one, the first collapses into the components you used to create it.

In combat, the Construct of Flesh takes its turn immediately after yours. On your turn you may use a bonus action to command it to attack, otherwise it may only move and Dodge on its turn. It may still use its reaction regardless of whether you commanded it to attack or not.

entries.name: Construct of Flesh
entries: {@i Medium Undead (Amalgamation), your alignment}
{@bold Armour Class} 15 (Natural Armour)
{@bold Hit Points} 30 + 2  your level
{@bold Speed} 30 ft.
{@bold Damage Resistances} poison
{@bold Damage Immunities} necrotic
{@bold Condition Immunities} {@condition charmed}, {@condition exhaustion}, {@condition frightened}, {@condition poisoned}
{@bold Senses} passive Perception 11 + PB
{@bold Proficiency Bonus} equals yours

{@bold Constructed.} When a Construct of Flesh is created, the creator chooses one of the abilities listed below and one of the attacks. The Construct of Flesh then loses all other abilities and attacks.
{@i Abilities:}

items: {@bold Arboreal.} Gains a climb speed of 30 ft. and has advantage on Athletics and Acrobatics checks.
{@bold Volant.} Gains a fly speed of 30 ft.
{@bold Nocturnal.} Gains {@sense darkvision} (120 ft.) and has advantage on Stealth and Perception checks.
{@bold Robust.} AC is increased to 17 and maximum hit points are increased to 50 + 2  your level.
{@bold Nimble.} Speed is increased to 45 ft. and Dexterity is increased by 2. If it succeeds a Dexterity saving throw to avoid half incoming damage, it instead avoids all of that damage.

entries: {@i Attacks:}

items: {@bold Vicious Bite.} {@atk mw} +4 + PB to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 2d6} + PB piercing damage plus {@damage 1d6} necrotic damage. Target must succeed a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC or take {@damage 2d4} poison damage.

{@bold Mighty Gore.} {@atk mw} +4 + PB to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 2d6} + PB bludgeoning damage plus {@damage 1d6} necrotic damage. Target must succeed a Strength saving throw against your spell save DC or be knocked {@condition prone}.
{@bold Noxious Spit.} {@atk rw} +4 + PB to hit, range 60 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 2d6} + PB acid damage plus {@damage 1d6} necrotic damage.

{@bold Gruesome Claw.} {@atk mw} +4 + PB to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 2d6} + PB slashing damage plus {@damage 1d6} necrotic damage. Target must succeed a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC or be {@condition frightened} of the Construct of Flesh until the end of their next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Artisan Crafter
entries: Your knowledge of your craft deepens to that of an experienced crafter. The items you craft using your Melder of Flesh and Bone ability become +2 items of their respective type.

subclassFeature.name: Improved Butcher
entries: You gain proficiency in another weapon type of your choosing.

subclassFeature.name: Improved Construct of Flesh
entries: You may select a second ability for your Construct of Flesh from its initial list of abilities. The selected ability cannot be the same as the first one you picked. The Construct of Flesh also gains Multiattack, allowing two attacks.

subclassFeature.name: Master Crafter
entries: Your creations are only rivalled by the works of master smiths. The items you craft using your Melder of Flesh and Bone ability become +3 items of their respective type.

subclassFeature.name: Body Modification
entries: Over the course of a long rest, you can incorporate one set of your crafted armour and up to two of your crafted weapons into your own flesh. They become a part of you and can only be removed if you choose to remove them over the course of a long rest. The weapons can be concealed within your body, and you may use a bonus action to draw them out.

subclassFeature.name: Minion Master
entries: The maximum hit points of your Construct of Flesh is increased by a further 60 hit points and its AC is increased by 2 (cumulative with the Robust ability if you selected it). You may select a second attack for your Construct of Flesh from its initial list of attacks. The selected attack cannot be the same as the first one you picked. All attacks made by your Construct of Flesh deal an additional {@damage 2d6} necrotic damage.

subclassFeature.name: Circle of Cycles
entries: A druidic circle who venerate the passage of time itself. They read the sun, moon, stars, and seasons to glimpse into the future and delve into the past. They wish to see the aeons pass with their own eyes and value longevity above all else.
You know the {@spell guidance} cantrip in addition to any other cantrips you know.

entries.caption: Circle of Cycles Spells
rows: 3rd
{@spell Augury}, {@spell Evolution/Devolution|DrDhrolinsDictionaryofDinosaurs}
5th
{@spell Clairvoyance}, {@spell Tongues}
9th
{@spell Legend Lore}, {@spell Contact Other Plane}
13th
{@spell Find the Path}, {@spell Contingency}, {@spell Flesh to Stone}, {@spell Investiture of Stone|XGE}
17th
{@spell Foresight}, {@spell Glibness}, {@spell Time Ravage|EGW}

subclassFeature.name: Adaptive Wild Shape
entries: Whenever you Wild Shape, you may choose to add one of the following additional characteristics to whatever you Wild Shape into:

items: You gain a climb speed of 30 ft., or it increases by 20 ft.
You gain a flight speed of 15 ft., or it increases by 10 ft. (optional rule at the DM's discretion; we suggest limiting this to Tiny and Small creatures you wild shape into until level 8).
You can breathe underwater and gain a swim speed of 30 ft., or it increases by 20 ft.
You gain {@sense darkvision} (60 ft.) or increase your darkvision by an additional 30 ft.
You may change the type of damage one of your attacks deals to poison or acid damage.

entries: From level 8 you may instead select two additional characteristics, and from level 14 you may instead select three additional characteristics. These Adaptive Wild Shapes override the limitations of the standard Wild Shape feature.

subclassFeature.name: Touch of Time
entries: Whenever you deal damage with a melee attack, you may select one of the dice you rolled and change its damage type to necrotic.

subclassFeature.name: Old Soul
entries: You age at half the normal rate  effectively doubling your lifespan. This increase stacks with Timeless Body when you reach level 18 (increasing your lifespan twenty-fold).

subclassFeature.name: Evolution/Devolution
entries: You learn the {@spell Evolution/Devolution|DrDhrolinsDictionaryofDinosaurs} spell and it is always prepared. It does not count towards the number of druid spells you can prepare each day.

subclassFeature.name: Celestial Alignment
entries: You have the ability to mimic celestial events to a limited degree. As an action, you may enact one of the following events, then must complete a long rest before you can do so again:

items: {@bold Partial Eclipse:} You may shroud an outside area of up to 10 miles in diameter in non-magical darkness for 10 minutes.
{@bold Full Lunar Phase:} You may illuminate an outside area of up to 10 miles in diameter in natural light for 10 minutes.
{@bold Constellation of the Warrior:} For the next minute, you and any allies within 15 ft. of you can reroll any melee attack roll of a natural 1 once per turn.
{@bold Constellation of the Sage:} For the next minute, you and any allies within 15 ft. of you can reroll any spell attack roll of a natural 1 once per turn.
{@bold Constellation of the Outlaw:} For the next minute, you and any allies within 15 ft. of you can reroll any ranged attack roll of a natural 1 once per turn.
{@bold Planetary Alignment:} For the next minute, you and any allies within 15 ft. of you gain proficiency in all saving throws.

subclassFeature.name: Deep Hibernation
entries: You gain the ability to go into a deep hibernation at will. This hibernation lasts for a minimum of 24 hours, but has no maximum length. While in this state, you do not age, do not need to eat, drink or sleep. After the minimum 24 hours has passed, you become aware of your surroundings and can wake at any point you choose. When you wake up from your hibernation, you gain the benefits of a long rest, gain temporary hit points equal to twice your level, and can permanently change how old you appear to be.

subclassFeature.name: Glimpse Future
entries: You have advantage on Dexterity saving throws. When an ally that you can see makes a Dexterity saving throw, you may use your reaction to give them advantage on that Dexterity saving throw, so long as they can hear and understand you.

subclassFeature.name: Commune with Past
entries: During hibernation, you can learn details about your world's past. These can be details that were long forgotten and have no written history, but must have been common knowledge at some point in time. This can include things such as ancient legends, tribal rivalries, and noticeable differences between the past and the current time.

subclassFeature.name: Commune with Future
entries: During hibernation, you can learn details about your world's possible future. These details must be common knowledge for people of the time explored and are what would occur if your party were to be absent for the rest of their lifetimes. This can include things such as legends, civilisation rivalries, and noticeable differences between the current time and the future.

subclassFeature.name: Guided Evolution
entries: When casting {@spell Evolution/Devolution|DrDhrolinsDictionaryofDinosaurs}, if you concentrate on this spell for the full 10 minutes, the changes become permanent until {@spell Evolution/Devolution|DrDhrolinsDictionaryofDinosaurs} is cast on this creature again or until that creature completes a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Future Sight
entries: So long as you are not {@condition incapacitated} or {@condition blinded}, you have advantage on all attacks and all attacks against you have disadvantage.

spell.name: Evolution/Devolution
entries: By touching a creature, you can cause it to take on attributes of its ancestors or descendants. A creature may accept these changes willingly or must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, you may pick one of the following changes and apply it to the creature's stat block for as long as you maintain concentration:

items: {@bold 1.} Increase or decrease the damage of all of the creature's attacks by {@dice 1d4}.
{@bold 2.} Increase or decrease the creature's movement speed by 20 ft.
{@bold 3.} The creature gains a climbing speed equal to half its movement, or its climbing speed is reduced by 30 ft. (it can be reduced to 0).
{@bold 4.} The creature gains a flying speed equal to half its movement, or its flying speed is reduced by 30 ft. (it can be reduced to 0).

{@bold 5.} Select one of the creature's attacks that cause slashing, piercing, or bludgeoning damage and change that damage type to poison, acid, fire, cold, or lightning, or select one of the creature's attacks that deal poison, acid, fire, cold, or lightning damage and change that damage type to slashing, piercing, or bludgeoning damage.

{@bold 6.} The creature gains {@sense darkvision} 60 ft., or reduces its darkvision (if it has it) by 60 ft. (it can be reduced to 0). If this creature does not have darkvision, you may reduce its maximum normal vision range to 60 ft.
{@bold 7.} Increase the creature's maximum hit points by {@dice 1d4} + 4, or reduce its maximum hit points by {@dice 1d4} + 4 (to a minimum of 1).

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you may pick another trait to change for each slot above 2nd level. You cannot pick the same trait more than once.

item.name: Ceratopsian Plate
entries: {@i Armour (any plate armour), rare (+1) or very rare (+2). Requires attunement.}
{@i Heavy sculpted armour with a horned helm and shoulders in the visage of a large ceratopsian.}

+1 or +2 armour. If you move at least 20 ft. in a straight line towards a creature and end your movement within 5 ft. of it, you may use your bonus action to strike the creature, dealing bludgeoning damage equal to your proficiency bonus and piercing damage equal to your proficiency bonus to it.
You and the creature must then make contested Strength checks. If you win, the struck creature is also knocked {@condition prone}.

activation.condition: After moving 20+ feet in a straight line toward a creature

item.name: Raptor Feather Leathers
entries: {@i Armour (any leather armour), rare (+1) or very rare (+2). Requires attunement.}
{@i A thick coat of feathers lined with leather on the inside.}

+1 or +2 armour. While attuned to this item, you have resistance to falling damage. When taking falling damage, you may use your reaction to instead gain immunity to falling damage until the end of your turn.

item.name: Dead Deity Robes
entries: {@i Wondrous item (robes). Requires attunement.}

{@i These beautiful, pristine red and black robes are the last remnants of a civilisation from millions of years in the past who worshipped a deity forgotten by all, aeons ago. They are inscribed with runes in an ancient unreadable language.}

While attuned to these robes, you have an additional spell slot of whatever your current highest level spell slot is. The level of the additional spell slot is reset and replenishes after each long rest. If you aren't wearing armour, your base Armour Class becomes 13 + your Dexterity modifier.

item.name: Automimicry Cape
entries: {@i Wondrous item (cape).}

{@i This large cape is dull on the back, but the inside is patterned and coloured with two huge eyes. When held up from either side, it gives the wearer the superficial image of a huge bestial head with glaring eyes.}
While wearing this cape, as a bonus action you can give yourself advantage on {@skill Intimidation} checks until the end of your turn against any creature with an Intelligence score of 5 or lower.

activation.condition: Gain advantage on Intimidation checks against creatures with INT 5 or lower

item.name: Pterosaur Wingbow
entries: {@i Weapon (any bow). Requires attunement.}

{@i This slender bow is made from pterosaur bones and stringed with a fine muscle tendon. The tendon can magically extend into a full wing membrane, connecting and wrapping the bones to form a gliding wing.}

+2 weapon. As a bonus action, the bow can be unfurled into a gliding wing, allowing the wielder to descend safely from any height, so long as they are not {@condition incapacitated}. Additionally, they may glide 2 ft. in any horizontal direction for every 1 ft. they descend, without using any movement.

item.name: Kriss of Haeg
entries: {@i Weapon (dagger or knife). Requires attunement.}
{@i This slender weapon has a wavy oscillating blade engraved with strange symbols.}

+3 weapon. A creature hit by an attack with this weapon must succeed a {@dc 10} Constitution saving throw or be reduced by one size category and have the damage from its attacks reduced by {@dice 1d4} for 1 minute. While reduced in size, it cannot be reduced in size again by another attack or similar spell/ability.

activation.condition: When you hit a creature with this weapon

item.name: The Taming Rod
entries: {@i Weapon (polearm or spear). Requires attunement.}
{@i A long pole with a bladed steel tip and a hooped ring of rope dangling from the end. A line of rope then runs parallel to the shaft and can be pulled to open or close the hoop.}
+1 weapon. While attuned to this weapon, you may attempt to tame an animal an additional time per day (either the same animal or a different one, see page 232).

item.name: Razortooth Sword
entries: {@i Weapon (any sword), uncommon, rare (+1), very rare (+2), or legendary (+3). Requires attunement if rare or rarer.}
{@i This gnarled sword is covered in sharp teeth embedded into its cutting edge.}

A creature hit by an attack with this weapon gains one level of Bleed Effect, as described below. The bonus conveyed by +1/+2/+3 versions of this weapon do not increase the damage this weapon deals when hitting, but instead add additional levels of Bleed Effect equal to the weapon's bonus (i.e. a +1 sword applies a total of 2 levels of Bleed Effect per hit).

items: A creature with this effect suffers 1 slashing damage at the start of its turn in combat for each level of bleed effect it has.
Outside of combat, a creature suffers 1 slashing damage every minute for each level of bleed effect it has, so long as it is not taking a short or long rest.
One level of bleed effect is removed per hit point of healing received.

All bleed effects can be simultaneously removed by completing a short or long rest, being restored to full health, or by a successful {@skill Medicine} check ({@dc 6} + level of bleed effect, to a maximum of 15).

item.name: Barron's Blunderbuss
entries: {@i Weapon (musket or hunting rifle), uncommon, rare (+1), very rare (+2), or legendary (+3). Requires attunement if rare or rarer.}
{@i A metal trumpet-like gun with a wide nozzle and bespoke wooden handle.}

This weapon can be loaded with any type of ammunition, or alternatively pebbles, scrap, or any cluster of small items you desire. However, its range becomes 60 ft. if you do so. Additionally, a DM can alter the damage type of this weapon to match what it is loaded with (i.e. putting a large rock in could change the damage to bludgeoning, or icicles could change it to cold damage).

item.name: Trusty Rusty
entries: {@i Weapon (warpick). Requires attunement.}
{@i This worn pick is rusted and corroding, but still maintains a sharp point.}
+3 weapon. While wielding this weapon, you gain a burrowing speed of 5 ft. Additionally, you have advantage on attacks against creatures made of rock or stone.

item.name: Protoceratops Quillbow
entries: {@i Weapon (any crossbow).}
{@i This wooden crossbow's end is carved into the beaked-mouth of a Protoceratops and its frill forms the crossbow's sights.}

This weapon's bolts detonate with tiny spines on impact. When a creature is hit by an attack made with this weapon, {@damage 1d4} piercing damage is inflicted to each creature within 5 ft. of the hit target.

item.name: Geological Hammer
entries: {@i Weapon (any hammer or one-handed mace).}
{@i This hammer has a broad flat head, and the back of the hammer is pointed into a triangular edge.}
In addition to its use as a weapon, this item can be used as a tool to efficiently extract resources from rock.

item.name: Theropod Jaw
entries: {@i Weapon (greataxe), uncommon, rare (+1), or very rare (+2). Requires attunement if very rare.}
{@i This huge axe is crafted from the harvested jaw of a mighty predatory dinosaur.}
This weapon deals an additional {@damage 1d6} piercing damage with each successful hit.

item.name: Azdarchid Beak Greatsword
entries: {@i Weapon (greatsword).}
{@i This lightweight sword is crafted from the huge beak of an Azdarchid pterosaur. It can slide through the air with ease.}

When using your reaction to make an attack of opportunity with this weapon, your melee reach is increased to 10 ft. for that attack. Furthermore, attacks made with this weapon against creatures from the elemental plane of air are made at advantage.

item.name: Sauropod Femur
entries: {@i Weapon (maul or mace).}
{@i This bony mace is topped with a large bulbous head. Despite its size, it is remarkably light.}
This weapon weighs half as much as it usually would, but is just as effective.

item.name: Wand of the Wondering Mind
entries: {@i A simple, wooden wand bound with twine and a small feather embedded in its tip.}

This wand has 3 charges. While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 of its charges and a beast you can see within 40 ft. of you must make a {@dc 12} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, select a Behaviour Table (pages 214217). You may then roll two dice for a behaviour and select whichever option of the two you prefer. The creature then behaves in that manner.
This wand regains all expended charges every day at dawn.

item.name: Refractive Index Crystal
item.reqAttune: by a druid, wizard, or sorcerer
entries: {@i Wondrous item (spell focus), uncommon (+1, "Exceptional"), rare (+2, "Flawless"), or very rare (+3, "Perfect"). Requires attunement by a druid, wizard, or sorcerer.}
{@i This large, jagged crystal has a pastel colour hue to it, but when turned in light it refracts brilliant rainbows.}

This item can be used as a spell focus by a druid, wizard, or sorcerer. While wielding this item, you may cast the {@spell light} cantrip a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus per day, and you may cast the spell {@spell colour spray} at 1st level once per day without using a spell slot.

item.name: Ancient Horn
entries: {@i Wondrous item (instrument).}
{@i A curved and polished bone horn made from the skull of a large hadrosaur.}

This instrument can be used as a spell focus by a bard. Once per day, as an action, the horn can be blown to alert allies. When used in this way, it cannot be heard by anyone except the bearer and their allies, who can hear it regardless of where they are in the multiverse. The sound itself does not convey specific information, and is simply a deep note.

item.name: Primal Drums
entries: {@i Wondrous item (instrument).}
{@i A small set of palm drums that are fashioned traditionally from skin stretched over hollowed wood.}
This instrument can be used as a spell focus by a bard. Once per day, as an action, these drums can be used to cast the spell {@spell bless} at 1st level without requiring a spell slot or components.

item.name: Staff of Time Sight
entries: {@i Weapon (quarterstaff). Requires attunement.}

{@i This wooden and brass staff is topped by a large, spinning brass sphere. This sphere is orbited by several smaller brass spheres that are not physically connected to the staff, yet cannot be removed from their orbit.}

This +2 staff can be used as a spell focus by a druid, wizard, or sorcerer. This staff has two charges. While wielding this staff, at the end of your turn in combat, you may choose to expend 1 of its charges. If you do, undo your entire turn (all actions, movement, and damage dealt/received) and re-take your turn. The staff regains 1 charge each day at dawn.

activation.condition: During combat, undo your entire turn and retake it

item.name: Staff of Unspared Expense
entries: {@i Weapon (quarterstaff), cursed. Requires attunement.}
{@i This pale ivory-coloured staff is topped with a piece of polished amber that contains a large insect fossil.}
This +3 staff can be used as a spell focus by a druid, wizard, or sorcerer. While wielding this staff, you have advantage on all Charisma checks and Charisma saving throws.

entries.name: Curse
entries: While in possession of this staff, all vendors try to sell their wares at prices 50% more expensive than normal to you. This staff is cursed and, once attuned, a player cannot unattune to it. If they were to abandon the staff, it appears among their belongings during the next short or long rest. The curse can be broken by selling the staff at 200% of its usual value (DM's choice).

Alternatively, the curse can be broken by destroying the staff by succeeding on a {@dc 25} Strength check. If the staff is destroyed in this manner, a blinding flash of light emits from the shattered amber, then heavy and intermittent stomping footsteps can be heard in the distance that steadily grow louder. This is the sound of a young/adult/ancient Tyrannosaurus rex approaching (age depends on the party level, at DM's discretion). It is hostile to the party, cannot be tamed, and will pursue them as long as it can. It will actively hunt them if the party escapes.

item.name: Amber Necklace
entries: {@i A simple twine necklace binding a small lump of amber, or a chain of amber beads.}
While wearing this necklace, you have a +2 bonus to any roll to resist or end the {@condition poisoned} condition. This effect is not cumulative with further amber items.

item.name: Ring of Primal Speaking
entries: {@i This small gold ring has the visage of a toothed maw biting onto a gemstone.}
While wearing this ring, you can read, speak, and understand Archosauric.

item.name: Ring of Palaeobotany
entries: {@i This wooden ring has a large emerald inlay. Within the emerald is a single tiny golden leaf.}
While wearing this ring you are able to recognise all ancient plants (that existed before your original timeline/lifespan) and you have knowledge of their uses and dangers.

item.name: Evolunite Shard
entries: {@i A tiny shard of iridescent rock that sparkles when in moonlight. When it comes into contact with a creature's integument (skin/scales/feathers/hair/etc.), it sparks and sizzles as it dissolves into them.}

If this mineral touches a creature's exposed body, it is destroyed. The DM then rolls on the Minor Mutation Table (page 218) for that creature, and it gains the associated mutation for 1 hour. If more than five Evolunite shards are used on the same creature within 1 hour of each other, the creature is {@condition polymorphed|phb|polymorphed} into a tiny crab with 2 hit points for 1 hour.

item.name: Potion of Redirected Ancestry
entries: {@i This ornate glass vial is inlaid with gold filigree. It contains a dully-glowing, green liquid that has tiny double helix shapes drifting within it.}

Consuming this potion allows you to take on the appearance and abilities of any humanoid race/species that you share a common ancestor with. These replace your character's original racial/species abilities and appearance. This effect lasts for 1 hour, however if you drink a second Potion of Redirected Ancestry while under this effect, the change becomes permanent unless removed by a {@spell wish} spell.

item.name: Potion of Plumage
entries: {@i This simple vial is filled with feathers immersed in a strange blue liquid.}

When this potion is consumed, the creature that drank it sprouts soft downy feathers all over their body and long flight feathers from their forearms for 10 minutes. While under this effect, they take no damage from falling and are able to glide 1 ft. horizontally for every 1 ft. they descend while falling.

item.name: Ethereal Egg
entries: {@i This football-sized egg is partly translucent, and wisps of coloured smoke constantly drift off of it.}

If incubated (kept warm) for {@dice 2d4} days, the egg will hatch into a familiar for the player who incubated it last. This functions in the same manner as a familiar would via the {@spell find familiar} spell, with the following exceptions:

items: The familiar's appearance and stats are selected by the hatching player from a list of known familiars (we recommend one of the Mesozoic familiars from this book), and then cannot be changed.
Once the familiar drops to 0 HP, it disappears and can be resummoned as an action.

Once the familiar drops to 0 HP for the third time, instead of disappearing, it reverts back to its Ethereal Egg form and must be incubated for a further {@dice 2d4} days before re-hatching as the same familiar.

item.name: Shell Coin
entries: {@i This shell has been carved into a small disc. It retains many of the surface features of the shell, including ribbing and growth lines.}

When entering a settlement of 100 inhabitants or more, this shell takes on the appearance of the highest value coin for that settlement. A {@dc 12} Arcana check can determine that the coin is magical, but an effect that dispels magic is required to reveal its illusion.

item.name: Dice of the Dinosaur
entries: {@i This six-sided die has the visages of six different large dinosaurs carved into each face. Once rolled, a strange bellowing noise can be heard in the distance.}

The first time that this die is rolled each day, it summons a dinosaur that matches the carved visage of the face it rolls to. The dinosaur is summoned somewhere within a 1 mile radius and is hostile to whoever rolled the die, actively seeking them out.

If the dinosaur is slain, it disintegrates into amber gemstones worth 100 gp multiplied by the corresponding number below. Once that dinosaur has been slain, the corresponding facing on the die turns blank and becomes weighted in a way that it cannot roll with that side face-up. At the next dawn, if the dinosaur is alive, it vanishes and the die remains unchanged.

entries.caption: Dice of the Dinosaur
rows: Iguanodon
100 gp
Centrosaurus
200 gp
Utahraptor
300 gp
Zuul
400 gp
Giraffatitan
500 gp
Tyrannosaurus
600 gp

activation.condition: On a hit with a ranged attack against a Large or larger creature
When you make a ranged weapon attack
When you make a ranged weapon attack
When you make a ranged weapon attack
When you reduce a Favoured Enemy to 0 hit points
During a long rest, using harvested bones
When you deal damage, you may change one damage die to necrotic
When an ally within 30 feet makes a Dexterity saving throw
While you have a creature grappled
When a creature moves within 5 feet of you while you are sleeping or resting
When you hit a creature with a weapon attack
